bcmSwitchMacroFlowECMPHashSeed Set Hash seed for ecmp macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowECMPUnderlayHashSeed Set Hash seed for ecmp level 2 macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowLoadBalanceHashSeed Set Hash Seed for Load balance macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowTrunkHashSeed Set Hash Seed for Trunk macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowHigigTrunkHashSeed Set Hash Seed for HiGig Trunk macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchECMPHashSet0Offset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for ECMP. Here, arg represents the offset of one wide hash value which is concatenated by various hash chunks sequentially. For BCM56850, these hash chunks are arranged as 16-bit hash A0, 16-bit hash B0, 4-bit LBN, 16-bit DPORT, 8-bit LBID, 8-bit SW1 LBID, 16-bit hash A1, 16-bit hash B1, 64-bit concatenated hash B1_B0_A1_A0, 4-bit LBN, 16-bit DPORT, 8-bit LBID and 8-bit SW1 LBID. For a given arg, both of the msb and chunk are determined. 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840), >100 concat mode (BCM56640,BCM56850)
bcmSwitchECMPHashSet1Offset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for ECMP. 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840)
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayHashSet0Offset BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for ECMP Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPVxlanHashOffset BCM56850 Enhanced hash select for VxLAN ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayVxlanHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for VxLAN ECMP Level 2 hashing. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPL2GreHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for L2Gre ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayL2GreHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for L2Gre ECMP Level 2 hashing. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPTrillHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for TRILL ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayTrillHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for TRILL ECMP hashing at Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPMplsHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for MPLS ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchVirtualPortDynamicHashOffset BCM56850 Enhanced hash select for Virtual port Aggregation group. 0-99
bcmSwitchVirtualPortUnderlayDynamicHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for Virtual port Aggregation group at Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillPayloadSelect0 Set hash control to select TRILL payload L2/L3 fields for Hash Block A. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L2: Inner L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillPayloadSelect1 Set hash control to select TRILL payload L2/L3 fields for Hash Block B. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L2: Inner L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillTunnelSelect0 Set hash control to select TRILL Tunnel L2/L3 fields for Hash Block A. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_OUTER_L2: Outer L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_TUNNEL_INNER_L2: Tunnel and inner l2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillTunnelSelect1 Set hash control to select TRILL Tunnel L2/L3 fields for Hash Block B. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_OUTER_L2: Outer L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_TUNNEL_INNER_L2: Tunnel and inner l2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashIP6AddrCollapseSelect0 Hash Control to collapse IPV6 addresses for hash block A. - BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_XOR
  • BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_LSB
cw bcmSwitchHashIP6AddrCollapseSelect1 Hash Control to collapse IPV6 addresses for hash block B. - BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_XOR
  • BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_LSB
cw bcmSwitchHashIPSecSelect0 Set hash control to select outer L4_SRC/DST_PORT or IPV6 SPI for hash block A. - BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_OUTER_L4_PORT
  • BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_SPI
cw bcmSwitchHashIPSecSelect1 Set hash control to select outer L4_SRC/DST_PORT or IPV6 SPI for hash block B. - BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_OUTER_L4_PORT
  • BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_SPI
cw bcmSwitchPrependTagEnable Enable Prepend tag per Port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPortEgressBlockL2 Apply egress mask port blocking on L2 traffic TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPortEgressBlockL3 Apply egress mask port blocking on L3 traffic TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRemoteLearnTrust Set the do not learn bit in HiGig header and act on it upon receive. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchAlternateStoreForward Configure faster packet store and forward mechanism. Also known as cut-through forwarding. - BCM56850 :
  • TRUE / FALSE (Cut-through / Store-And-Forward) Only 40G port supports Cut-through mode, if this port is configured in oversubscription mode.- BCM56960 :
  • bcmPortAsfModeStoreAndForward [0] Store and Forward (SAF) mode
  • bcmPortAsfModeSameSpeed [1] Cut-thru forwarding between same speed ports
  • bcmPortAsfModeSlowToFast [2] Cut-thru forwarding between slower to faster speed ports
  • bcmPortAsfModeFastToSlow [3] Cut-thru forwarding between faster to slower speed ports BCM56960 supports aforementioned additional modes of cut-through.
bcmSwitchIpmcGroupMtu For ingress MTU check for all IPMC groups TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSourceMacZeroDrop If set, packets which have a MAC SA of all zeroes will be dropped. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBpduInvalidVlanDrop BPDU packets are dropped or forwarded when the packet going out contains an invalid VLAN. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMirrorInvalidVlanDrop Mirror-to-port packets are dropped or forwarded when the packet going out contains an invalid VLAN. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMirrorPktChecksEnable All packet checks are enabled or disabled for mirrored packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUniformUcastTrunkDistribution Improve the trunk distribution for unicast trunking with non power of two number of trunk ports. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUniformFabricTrunkDistribution Improve the trunk distribution for HiGig trunking with non power of two number of trunk ports. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanL3Route Enable L2 switching of IP Multicast (IPMC) packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruning When FALSE, allow both L2 and L3 copies of a packet to go out on a physical port if it happens to be a member of both the L2 and L3 bitmaps of the replication group. When TRUE (default), only the L3 copy goes out. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruningOverride This is only relevant when bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruning is TRUE. When set to TRUE, allows both L2 and L3 copies of a packet to go out on a physical port, if the port happens to be a member of both the L2 and L3 bitmaps of the replication group. When FALSE, only the L3 copy goes out. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcReplicationSharing When TRUE, allow a linked list of VLANs or L3 interfaces to be shared among multiple {IPMC group, egress port} entities in IPMC replication. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcReplicationAvailabilityThreshold If the IPMC replication table's available space falls below this threshold, conservation of replication table space takes higher priority than distribution of IPMC traffic among trunk members by hashing. This threshold is specified in whole percentages. 0-100
bcmSwitchL3IngressMode 0 - Traditional L3 Ingress interface management. (default) 1 - Advanced L3 Ingress Interface(L3-IIF) management. L3 Interfaces (L3-IIF) for MPLS and L3 Tunnels are constructed using bcm_l3_ingress_create(). 0/1
bcmSwitchL3HostAsRouteReturnValue 0 - Traditional bcm_l3_host_add API return value. (default) 0x01 - 0xFF - Application to specify 8-bit return value for bcm_l3_host_add API with BCM_L3_HOST_AS_ROUTE flag. If prefix gets added to DEFIP table, then return value=<8-bit specified value> If prefix gets added to HOST table, then return value=0 0/1
bcmSwitchL3EgressMode 0 - Traditional egress management. (default). Nexthop destinations are constructed and shared dynamically through destination related members in bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t. 1 - Application controls egress management. Nexthop destinations are constructed using bcm_l3_egress_create() and bcm_l3_egress_multipath_create(). When in this mode, the bcm_l3_host_t.l3a_intf member and bcm_l3_route_t.l3a_intf member must be a bcm_if_t that was created by bcm_l3_egress_create() or bcm_l3_egress_multipath_create(). The following members of bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t are ignored:
  • l3a_nexthop_mac
  • l3a_modid
  • l3a_port_tgid
  • l3a_vid The following members of bcm_mpls_switch_t are ignored for LSR.
  • next_mac
  • next_vlan
  • next_mod
  • next_port
  • next_trunk
  • push_label1 The following members of bcm_mpls_switch_t are ignored for LER.
  • next_mac
  • next_vlan
  • dst_mod
  • dst_port
  • dst_trunk The following flags for bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t are ignored:
  • BCM_L3_L2ONLY
  • BCM_L3_TGID
  • BCM_L3_L2TOCPU
  • BCM_L3_MUTLIPATH
0/1
bcmSwitchUnknownIpmcAsMcast If set, threat unknown IPMC as L2 Mcast TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelUnknownIpmcDrop If set, drop unknown IPMC for incoming tunnel. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDhcpLearn If set, learn MACSA of DHCP packet. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcTtl1ToCpu If set, copy L3 multicast with TTL 1 to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UcastTtl1ToCpu If set, copy L3 unicast with TTL 1 to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDosAttackFlagZeroSeqZero, If enable, drop packet with TCP sequence number and all control bits are zero. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDosAttackSynFrag If enable, drop TCP SYN packet with source port 0-1023 for the first segment. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrExtLengthEnable If disable, ignore HDR_EXT_LEN field in HiGig+ header in parsing HiGig+ header. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp4McastL2DestCheck If enable, check for lower 23 bits of MACDA matches with lower 23 bits of destination IP address of IPv4 multicast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp6McastL2DestCheck If enable, check for lower 32-bits of MACDA matches with lower 32-bits of destination IP address of IPv6 multicast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3InterfaceUrpfEnable If enabled, URPF check is per L3_IIF. If disabled, URPF check is per physical port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3TunnelUrpfMode Reverse path check mode for unicast tunneled packets. - BCM_SWITCH_URPF_DISABLE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_LOOSE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_STRICT
bcmSwitchL3TunnelUrpfDefaultRoute If enable, tunneled packets will be accepted even when reverse route is a default gateway. Relevant only if URPF check is enabled for tunneled packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfFailToCpu Enable trap URPF fail packets to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfRouteEnable Enable route lookup for URPF check. Enabling or disabling this switch control will erase device route table completely. Enabling this control will reduce total number of routes device can accommodate by 50%. Half of the routes will be allocated to reverse source Disabling this control will restore route table size back to normal. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfRouteEnableExternal Enable route lookup for URPF check. If L3 prefixes are completely within external-TCAM, enabling or disabling this switch control will not erase any of device route table entries installed.
bcmSwitchL3UrpfMode Per port reverse path check mode for unicast packets. - BCM_SWITCH_URPF_DISABLE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_LOOSE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_STRICT
bcmSwitchL3UrpfDefaultRoute If enable, unicast packets will be accepted even when reverse route is a default gateway. Relevant only if URPF check is enabled for unicast packets on the port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3Max128BV6Entries Sets the maximum number of 128B V6 LPM routes. Default value depends on the configuration variable num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries.When bcm_l3_init is called, maximum number of 128B V6 entries is read from the configuration variable num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries. If this variable is not set, then the default value depends on the value of the configuration variable ipv6_lpm_128b_enable. If ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is 1, then the default value is 2048. If ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is 0, then the default valu e is 0. if ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is not defined as well then the default value is 2048. Please note that if bcmSwitchL3Max128BV6Entries is set to a value different from the value of num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries, then Level1 warmboot recovery can cause SER errors. However Level2 warmboot recovery works fine. For Trident2 and Triumph3, valid range is 0-4096. Value should be multiple of 2. Otherwise it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 2
bcmSwitchIngressRateLimitIncludeIFG Per port, add additional bytes to ingress metering for each packet to account for IFG. Some devices may round off the given value to a restricted set. 0-63
bcmSwitchRateLimitLinear If set, shaping and egress metering limits are linear. Some systems allow non-linear limits when disabled. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashL2Dual Second hash select for L2. If the value is not equal to the setting for bcmSwitchHashL2, then the L2 host table is placed in dual-hash mode. If the value is set equal to bcmSwitchHashL2, dual-hash mode is disabled. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashL3Dual Second hash select for L3. If the value is not equal to the setting for bcmSwitchHashL3, then the L3 host table is placed in dual-hash mode. If the value is set equal to bcmSwitchHashL3, dual-hash mode is disabled. Same as bcmSwitchHashL3
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepth Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode. When dual hash mode is enabled on a table, this control value will enable software-assisted rearrangement of the hash table upon hardware insert failure. The driver will attempt to rearrange the entries in the table to allow the insertion of the new entry. The driver will be more aggressive (and potentially less responsive during insert attempts) as this value increases. While no maximum value is indicated, any value greate r than 3 will consume significant system resources. A value of zero will disable software rearrangement. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthL2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthMpls Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthEgressVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for egress VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthL3 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthIngVpVlanMember Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for ING_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP table. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthEgrVpVlanMember Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for EGR_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP table. >=0
bcmSwitchHashL2DualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashL3DualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMPLSDualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepth Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode. When different hash modes are configured on multi bank hash tables, this control value will enable software-assisted rearrangement of the hash table upon hardware insert failure. The driver will attempt to rearrange the entries in the table to allow the insertion of the new entry. The driver will be more aggressive (and potentially less responsive during insert attempts) as this value increases. While no maximum value is indicated, any value greater than 3 will consume significant system resources. A value of zero will disable software rearrangement. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlanTranslate1 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN XLATE_1 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlanTranslate2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN XLATE_2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthMpls Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlanTranslate1 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN XLATE_1 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlanTranslate2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN XLATE_2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthExactMatch Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for FPEM tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL3 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL3Tunnel` Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L3 Tunnel tables. >=0
bcmSwitchVrfMax Maximum Virtual Routing and Forwarding ID for the device. By default it is preset to a maximum supported VRF value which might be changed to desired value less than maximum and represents power of two minus one. 2^x - 1
bcmSwitchFailoverStackTrunk Is Read-only and indicates if HW support exists for Failover detection on Stack ports TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFailoverEtherTrunk Is Read-only and indicates if HW support exists for Failover detection on Ether ports TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSharedVlanEnable Enable shared VLAN learning. This is different from the older shared VLAN mechanism which specifies a global shared VLAN ID (enabled using bcm_vlan_control_set, with bcmVlanShared and bcmVlanSharedID). This newer mechanism allows a shared VLAN ID to be specified for each VLAN (see bcm_vlan_control_vlan_set). TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSharedVlanL2McastEnable Use shared VLAN ID for L2 multicast lookup TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFlood Multicast flood mode setting used in the HiGig Header. This setting is always used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig (except BCM5660x). For other multicast packets, this setting is only used if bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFloodOverride is enabled. Otherwise, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. HiGig multicast flood mode, see table BCM_VLAN_MCAST_FLOOD_table
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFloodOverride If set, the multicast flood mode specified by bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFlood is used for non-IPMC packets sent over HiGig. If not set, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFlood IPMC multicast flood mode setting used in the HiGig Header (BCM5660x only). This setting is used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig if bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFloodOverride is enabled. Otherwise, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. IPMC HiGig multicast flood mode, see table BCM_VLAN_MCAST_FLOOD_table
bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFloodOverride If set, the multicast flood mode specified by bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFlood is used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig (BCM5660x only). If not set, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSTPBlockedFieldBypass If the ingress port's spanning tree state is in blocked state, then the FP is disabled when this control is set to TRUE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2PortBlocking Enable selective port blocking per MAC address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngress Hash select for Ingress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngressDual Secondary Hash select for Ingress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngress
bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgress Hash select for Egress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgressDual Secondary Hash select for Egress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgress
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastVlanRange Allowed range of broadcast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastL2Range Allowed range of multicast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchHgHdrL3L2Range Allowed range of IP multicast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchMcastL2Range Allowed range of multicast indices in device tables 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchL3L2Range Allowed range of IP multicast indices in device tables 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchControlPortConfigInstall Install new port configuration. For XCore/Caladan3 device only. 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchAutoQueues Auto queue configuration mode on initialization. For XCore devices only the Get API is valid. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2McastAllRouterPortsAddEnable Enable addition of all-router ports to every L2 multicast entry TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchKeepEgressRtHdr Leave XCore Egress Route Header on packets for a given port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFieldCache Enable caching of Rule table or classification entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFieldCommit Flush the cached Rule table or classification entries to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcCache Enable caching of IP Multicast S,G entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcCommit Flush the cached IP Multicast table entries to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2Cache Enable caching of MAC address entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2Commit Flush the cached MAC address table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2AgeDelete Enable deletion of MAC addresses during aging scan. The default value is TRUE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2AgeScan Scan all MAC addresses and decrement age-status. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HostCache Enable caching of L3 Host table entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HostCommit Flush the cached L3 Host table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3RouteCache Enable caching of L3 Route table entries. Will not be restored after warmboot. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3RouteCommit Flush the cached L3 Route table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBypassMode Enable skipping some switch features for improved latency. - BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_NONE
  • BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_L3_ONLY
  • BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_L3_AND_FP
bcmSwitchStgInvalidToCpu Copy to CPU packets going out on port with STG state not forwarding TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpu Copy to CPU packets on egress with VLAN translation miss if expected to hit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3PktErrToCpu Copy to CPU Packets with IP length field is longer than the actual packet length TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpu Copy to CPU packets with L2 MTU Failure. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpu Copy to CPU packets with Split horizon or SVP pruning (SVP==DVP) failure TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpu Copy to CPU packets with incoming WLAN SVP which did not arrive on the expected tunnel TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchDrop Drop/Do not forward packets with incoming WLAN SVP which did not arrive on the expected tunnel TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpu Copy to CPU WLAN packets that have a SVP miss TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsCtrlPktToCpu Copy to CPU MPLS control packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchInvalidTpidToCpu Copy to CPU Invalid tag protocol ID packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFlowSelectMissToCpu Copy to CPU packets that miss flow selection TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HdrMismatchToCpu Copy to CPU L3 header mismatch packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUnknownVlanToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchUnknownVlanToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressStgInvalidToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchEgressStgInvalidToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchTunnelErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HeaderErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchL3HeaderErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressL3PktErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchL3PktErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcTtlErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchIpmcTtlErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchHgHdrErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpfixRateViolationDataInsert Allow to insert new IPFIX flow entry when flow setup rate exceeds the configured rate limit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpfixRateViolationPersistent Do not allow to change flow setup rate status of existing flows. When a new flow is established, flow setup rate status is recorded according to whether the new flow setup rate of that time exceeds the configured rate limit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelIp4IdShared If set to FALSE, the IPv4 ID space can be selected on a per tunnel basis, otherwise it is the same across all tunnels. Default is FALSE wherever supported (BCM56634 and BCM56524). TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientAuthorizeAll If set, all WLAN clients are authorized and will disable WLAN client lookup. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56640. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientAuthPendingToCpu If set, packets from unauthorized wireless clients are sent to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientUnauthToCpu If set, unauthorized clients are sent to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientRoamedOutErrorToCpu If set, roamed out wireless clients' error packets are sent to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientSrcMacMissToCpu Enable for copy to CPU upon a wireless client database SA lookup miss. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientDstMacMissToCpu Enable for copy to CPU upon a wireless client database DA lookup miss. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamHdrErrToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an OAM header error. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnknownVerToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an OAM version number not equal to 0. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnknownVerDrop Enable drop for an OAM version number not equal to 0. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnexpectedPktToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an unexpected OAM MDL value. The default value is FALSE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamCcmToCpu Enable switching an unexpected MEPID or Interval to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamXconCcmToCpu Enable switching CCM with low MDL or unexpected MAID to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamXconOtherToCpu Enable switching other than CCM OAM PDU with low OAM MDL value to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamOlpHeaderAdd Enable or disable OLP header addition to OAM packets copied to CPU. OLP header addition is enabled by default for OAM packets. Please note that Embedded applications such as Ethernet LM/DM and MPLS LM/DM will not work correctly if OLP header addition is disabled. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3SrcBindFailToCpu If set, packets with source MAC-SIP binding check failures are copied to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchLayeredQoSResolution If set to TRUE, enable layered QoS resolution. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCustomerQueuing Enable customer domain queuing. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCosqStatThreshold Sets Statistics Threshold to ACE-TCE Mode. 0,25-75%
bcmSwitchCosqStatInterval Sets background ejection Statistics Interval in ms. Min of 0. Max depends on clock rate of the chip. For 400MHz, its 10737ms.
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentLowerRange1 Configure the Port Independent Lower MPLS Label for Range-1. The default value is 0. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentUpperRange1 Configure the Port Independent Upper MPLS Label for Range-1. The default value is 2^20 - 1. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentLowerRange2 Configure the Port Independent Lower MPLS Label for Range-2. The default value is 0. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentUpperRange2 Configure the Port Independent Upper MPLS Label for Range-2. The default value is 2^20 - 1. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchPFCClass0Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 0 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass1Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 1 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass2Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 2 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass3Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 3 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass4Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 4 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass5Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 5 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass6Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 6 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass7Queue Queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 7 packet is received. 0x0-0x7 or unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass0McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 0 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass1McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 1 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass2McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 2 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass3McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 3 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass4McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 4 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass5McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 5 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass6McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 6 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass7McastQueue Multiple queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 7 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass0DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 0 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass1DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 1 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass2DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 2 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass3DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 3 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass4DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 4 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass5DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 5 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass6DestmodQueue Destination module queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 6 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass7DestmodQueue Multiple queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 7 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCQueue0Class Priority Flow Control class for CoS queue 0. 0x0-0x7 or PFC priority class
bcmSwitchPFCQueue1Class Priority Flow Control class for CoS queue 1. 0x0-0x7 or PFC priority class
bcmSwitchPFCQueue2Class Priority Flow Control class for CoS queue 2. 0x0-0x7 or PFC priority class
bcmSwitchPFCQueue3Class Priority Flow Control class for CoS queue 3. 0x0-0x7 or PFC priority class

bcmSwitchPFCQueue7Class Priority Flow Control class for CoS queue 7. 0x0-0x7 or PFC priority class
bcmSwitchReserveLowVlanPort Reserve a range of VLAN gport resource ids, sets the lower bounds 0x0-0xFFFFFFFF
bcmSwitchReserveHighVlanPort Reserve a range of VLAN gport resource ids, sets the upper bounds 0x0-0xFFFFFFFF

bcmSwitchReserveHighVpn Reserve a range of VPN resource ids, sets the upper bounds 0x0-0xFFFFFFFF
bcmSwitchSnapNonZeroOui Allow LLC formatted L2 packets that have non-zero value OUI field to be treated as SNAP packets. 0x0-0x7

bcmSwitchEncapErrorToCpu Send packet with unknown encapsulation on stacking port to CPU 1

bcmSwitchTimeSyncPktDrop Drop packet matched timing and synchronization MAC and EtherType 1

bcmSwitchMmrpPktFlood Flood to VLAN packet matched Multiple MAC Registration Protocol MAC and EtherType 1

bcmSwitchSrpPktDrop Drop packet matched Multiple Stream Registration Protocol MAC and EtherType 1
bcmSwitchSrpPktFlood Flood to VLAN packet matched Multiple Stream Registration Protocol MAC and EtherType 1
bcmSwitchSRPEthertype Multiple Stream Registration Protocol EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchMMRPEthertype Multiple MAC Registration Protocol EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchTimeSyncEthertype Timing and Synchronization Protocol EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchFcoeEtherType FCOE Protocol EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchGbpEtherType Configurable EtherType for Group Based Policy [GBP] protocol Ethertype
bcmSwitchCustomOuterEthertype1 Outer EtherType 1 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications Ethertype
bcmSwitchCustomOuterEthertype2 Outer EtherType 2 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications Ethertype
bcmSwitchCustomInnerEthertype1 Inner EtherType 1 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications Ethertype
bcmSwitchCustomInnerEthertype2 Inner EtherType 2 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications Ethertype
bcmSwitchCustomOuterProtocolId1 Outer Protocol ID 1 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 0-255, 8 bit number
bcmSwitchCustomOuterProtocolId2 Outer Protocol ID 2 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 0-255, 8 bit number
bcmSwitchCustomInnerProtocolId1 Inner Protocol ID 1 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 0-255, 8 bit number
bcmSwitchCustomInnerProtocolId2 Inner Protocol ID 2 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 0-255, 8 bit number
bcmSwitchCustomOuterUdpDstPort1 Outer UDP Dest Port 1 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 16-bit number
bcmSwitchCustomOuterUdpDstPort2 Outer UDP Dest Port 2 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 16-bit number
bcmSwitchCustomInnerUdpDstPort1 Inner UDP Dest Port 1 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 16-bit number
bcmSwitchCustomInnerUdpDstPort2 Inner UDP Dest Port 2 in the payload of a tunnel used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 16-bit number
bcmSwitchSRPDestMacOui Multiple Stream Registration Protocol Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchMMRPDestMacOui Multiple MAC Registration Protocol Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTimeSyncDestMacOui Timing and Synchronization Protocol Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchSRPDestMacNonOui Multiple Stream Registration Protocol Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Lower 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchMMRPDestMacNonOui Multiple MAC Registration Protocol Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Lower 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTimeSyncDestMacNonOui Timing and Synchronization Protocol Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Lower 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTimeSyncMessageTypeBitmap Timing and Synchronization Protocol message bitmap to match Message bitmap
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassAPktPrio Set Priority for the Class A class A priority
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassBPktPrio Set Priority for the Class B class B priority
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassExeptionAPktPrio Set Remapping Priority for the exception packets in Class A class A priority
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassExeptionBPktPrio Set Remapping Priority for the exception packets in Class B class B priority
bcmSwitchGvrpToCpu CPU port is the destination port of GVRP frame. 1
bcmSwitchGmrpToCpu CPU port is the destination port of GMRP frame. 1
bcmSwitchL3DefipMultipathCountUpdate Enable this control to update all associated ECMP_COUNT within L3_DEFIP, when ECMP changes occur through bcm_multipath_egress_xxx API Applicable for pre Firebolt-2 devices. 1
bcmSwitchL2McIdxRetType When set to 1, L2 multicast API will return multicast index as bcm_multicast_t instead of hardware multicast index. 1
bcmSwitchL3McIdxRetType When set to 1, IP multicast API will return multicast index as bcm_multicast_t instead of hardware multicast index. 1
bcmSwitchMcastSaDrop Drop the packet if the SA is mcast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchJumboFrameDrop Drop the Jumbo frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDroppedJumboFrameDisLearn No learn on the dropped Jumbo frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRangeErrDrop Drop the range error frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDroppedRangeErrDisLearn No learn on the dropped range error frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchArpDhcpToCpu Packet with ARP or DHCP to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIgmpMldToCpu Packet with IGMP or MLD protocol type to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchLinkDownInfoSkip When set to 1, Link status changes notification will not retrieve port information before calling registered callback. Only applies to down links; up links retrieve port information irrespective of this switch control. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDestMacZeroDrop If set, packets which have a MAC DA of all zeroes will be dropped. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2SourceDiscardMoveToCpu If set, packets which have a MAC SA discard configuration will be sent to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchServiceTpidReplace If set, TPID will be replaced in Service Delimiting SD-TAG (Supported only for Triumph2 (5663x), Enduro (5633x), and Trident (5684x)) TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEEEPipelineTime Time for MAC to ensure that the egress pipeline is empty prior to the assertion of the LPI control signal. system clock cycles
bcmSwitchEEEGlobalCongestionThreshold If this threshold is exceeded, EEE is disabled for all ports. buffer cell size
bcmSwitchFiltersControlList For get only. To report the supported Filter bypass control items with bitmap format. - BCM_FILTER_NONE
  • BCM_FILTER_RX_CRCCHK
  • BCM_FILTER_DOS_TOCPU
  • BCM_FILTER_STP_USERADDR
  • BCM_FILTER_STP_MAC0X

  • BCM_L2_INGRESS_DIST

bcmSwitchPortBasedQos If set, the ingress priority on a frame will be decided by the ingress port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicSampleRate The number of times each port's transmitted bytes and queued bytes are sampled and their exponentially weighted moving averages computed in a second. Sampling period ranges from 1 to 255 microseconds.
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicEgressBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of each port's exponentially weighted average of bytes transmitted during a sampling interval. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of each port's exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicEgressBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicEgressBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. 0 to maximum fabric trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicEgressBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. 0 to maximum fabric trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. 0 to maximum fabric trunk port queue size
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. 0 to maximum fabric trunk port queue size
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicHashOffset BCM56860/BCM56960 Enhanced hash selections for trunk dynamic load balancing. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_DLB_LAG, OFFSET_DLB_LAG, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_DLB_LAG fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960) ,>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicSampleRate The number of times historical member load and queued bytes are sampled and their exponentially weighted moving averages computed in a second. Sampling period ranges from 1 to 15 milliseconds.
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicAccountingSelect Method of accounting for trunk dynamic load balancing. - 0 - Physical link accounting
  • 1 - Virtual link accounting
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicEgressBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of exponentially weighted average of bytes transmitted during a sampling interval. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicEgressBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. Applicable to physical link accounting. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. Applicable to physical link accounting. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicEgressBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicEgressBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port queue size
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicQueuedBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port queue size
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicExpectedLoadMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the historical and instantaneous expected member load. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicExpectedLoadMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the historical and instantaneous expected member load. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to maximum trunk port bandwidth
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicImbalanceMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in percentage, used to quantize the historical and instantaneous member load imbalance. Applicable to virtual link accounting. -100 to 100
bcmSwitchTrunkDynamicImbalanceMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in percentage, used to quantize the historical and instantaneous member load imbalance. Applicable to virtual link accounting. -100 to 100
bcmSwitchTrunkResilientHashOffset The Resilaing Hashing LAG key is barrel shifted by this value. 0x0-0x0F
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicHashOffset BCM56860/BCM56960 Enhanced hash selections for ECMP dynamic load balancing. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_DLB_ECMP, OFFSET_DLB_ECMP, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_DLB_ECMP fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicSampleRate The number of times historical member load and queued bytes are sampled and their exponentially weighted moving averages computed in a second. Sampling period ranges from 1 to 15 milliseconds.
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicAccountingSelect Method of accounting for ECMP dynamic load balancing. - 0 - Physical link accounting
  • 1 - Virtual link accounting
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicEgressBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of exponentially weighted average of bytes transmitted during a sampling interval. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicQueuedBytesExponent The exponent used in the calculation of exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to 15
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicEgressBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. Applicable to physical link accounting. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicQueuedBytesDecreaseReset If set, the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes is updated with the sampled value if the sample value is less than the average. Applicable to physical link accounting. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicEgressBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum port bandwidth
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicEgressBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of transmitted bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum port bandwidth
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicQueuedBytesMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum port queue size
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicQueuedBytesMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in bytes, used to quantize the exponentially weighted average of queued bytes. Applicable to physical link accounting. 0 to maximum port queue size
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicExpectedLoadMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the historical and instantaneous expected member load. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to maximum port bandwidth
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicExpectedLoadMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in millions of bits per second (mbps), used to quantize the historical and instantaneous expected member load. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to maximum port bandwidth
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicImbalanceMinThreshold The minimum threshold, in percentage, used to quantize the historical and instantaneous member load imbalance. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to 100
bcmSwitchEcmpDynamicImbalanceMaxThreshold The maximum threshold, in percentage, used to quantize the historical and instantaneous member load imbalance. Applicable to virtual link accounting. 0 to 100
bcmSwitchEcmpResilientHashOffset Enhanced hash selections for ECMP resilient hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchFailoverDropToCpu Protection data drop to CPU enable. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsReservedEntropyLabelToCpu Packet is copied to the CPU if the entropy label falls between the reserved range (0-15). TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3SrcBindMissToCpu Send a copy of L3 packet to CPU if SIP lookup fails in HPAE mode. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsGalAlertLabelToCpu When a GAL label is exposed in a packet, such a packet will be dropped. This control determines whether such a packet gets copied to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsRalAlertLabelToCpu When a RAL label is exposed in a packet, such a packet will be dropped. This control determines whether such a packet gets copied to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsIllegalReservedLabelToCpu Expose an illegal reserved label to CPU. For example, exposed GAL Label has BOS=0. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsLookupsExceededToCpu Expose out of lookups to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsUnknownAchTypeToCpu Packet has an unknown ACH Type. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsUnknownAchVersionToCpu The version number of ACH is not 1. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTimesyncUnknownVersionToCpu The version number is not recognized. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTimesyncIngressVersion Ingress 1588 version 0:V2 1:>V2 0:Version2 1:Greater than V2
bcmSwitchTimesyncEgressVersion Egress 1588 version 0:V2 1:>V2 0:Version2 1:Greater than V2
bcmSwitchCongestionCnmToCpu Send ICNM packets to the CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwtichCongestionCnmProxyErrorToCpu Enable forwarding to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwtichCongestionCnmProxyToCpu This is to copy the dropped CNM packet to CPU if a network administrator needs to look at them. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2GreTunnelMissToCpu If set, send a copy of L2GRE packet to CPU if Tunnel lookup fails. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2GreVpnIdMissToCpu If set, send a copy of L2GRE packet to CPU if VPNID lookup fails. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2GreVpnIdSizeSet Set bit-size of VPNID within L2-GRE Key - 16 - 16-bit VPNID, 16-bit Entropy
  • 20 - 20-bit VPNID, 12-bit Entropy
  • 24 - 24-bit VPNID, 8-bit Entropy
  • 32 - 32-bit VPNID, 0-bit Entropy
bcmSwitchL2GreProtocolType Set protocol-type for L2-GRE 16-bit number
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelErrorDrop WLAN Decryption offload enable. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsReservedEntropyLabelDrop When the value of the received entropy label falls in the reserved range(0-15), this control will determine if the packet is dropped or not. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRemoteProtectionTrust If set, use the Protection Status bit in the received HiGig Header at Egress device. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRemoteProtectionEnable Set the Protection Status bit in HiGig Header at Ingress device. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacLowPower If set, the MAC will enable the low power mode. system frequency(kHz) of low power mode, 0 indicates low power mode disabled.
bcmSwitchCongestionCntag Enable/Disable CN-TAG processing. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCongestionCntagEthertype Ethernet type value for CN-TAG. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchCongestionCnm Enable/Disable congestion notification message handling. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCongestionCnmEthertype Ethernet type value for congestion notification message. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchCongestionNotificationIdHigh Device identifier for constructing the most significant 24-bit (bit 63:40) of congestion point identifier. 0-0xffffff
bcmSwitchCongestionNotificationIdLow Port identifier for constructing bit 39:24 of congestion point identifier. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchCongestionNotificationIdQueue Queue mode of the congestion point identifier. When set to 0 use congestion managed queue ID, otherwise use queue number. 0-1
bcmSwitchCongestionUseOuterTpid Outer tag TPID value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchCongestionUseOuterVlan Outer tag VLAN value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-0xfff
bcmSwitchCongestionUseOuterPktPri Outer tag priority value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-7
bcmSwitchCongestionUseOuterCfi Outer tag CFI value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-1
bcmSwitchCongestionUseInnerPktPri Inner tag priority value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-7
bcmSwitchCongestionUseInnerCfi Inner tag CFI value to be used for congestion notification message. 0-1
bcmSwitchCongestionMissingCntag Choose the CNM generation behavior when congestion notification threshold is reached but the incoming sampled packet does not have CN-TAG. When set to 0, construct the CNM without CN-TAG. When set to 1, construct the CNM with NULL flow identifier. When set to -1, discard the CNM. 0, 1, -1
bcmSwitchCongestionExcludeReplications Take the replicated packets in account during the congestion test. \cw
bcmSwitchMiMDefaultSVP If set, MiM termination lookup miss packets are forwarded using default SVP. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressDroppedReportZeroLength If set, egress pipeline reports zero length for dropped packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressPktAge Chip-wide egress packet aging time. Currently only supported on BCM88230 family of devices. time in milliseconds
bcmSwitchLoadBalanceHashSelect Selects which hash function to use for Load Balance computation. - 0x0 - ZERO.Hash entry always zero.
  • 0x1 - hashing based on SA, VLAN, EtherType, source module ID/port.
  • 0x2 - hashing based on DA, VLAN, EtherType, source module ID/port.
  • 0x3 - hashing based on SA/DA, VLAN, EtherType, source module ID/port.
  • 0x4 - hashing based on SIP and source TCP/UDP port.
  • 0x5 - hashing based on DIP and destination TCP/UDP port.
  • 0x6 - hashing based on SIP/DIP and source/destination TCP/UDP port.
  • 0x7 - Enhanced (RTAG7) HASHING
bcmSwitchStableSelect This is a "get-only" control. To select the persistent storage location, the application needs to call soc_stable_set before soc_init during both Cold and Warm Boot initialization. N/A
bcmSwitchStableSize This is a "get-only" control. To select the persistent storage size, the application needs to call soc_stable_size_set before soc_init during both Cold and Warm Boot initialization. N/A
bcmSwitchStableUsed This is a "get-only" control to determine the actual usage of the persistent storage. N/A
bcmSwitchStableConsistent This is a "get-only" control to determine whether reload possible using Warm Boot. It indicates that an API call which may affect scache state did not complete if cleared. N/A
bcmSwitchControlSync The "set" call instructs the SDK to push its dynamic state to the persistent storage. The "get" call indicates whether or not the state is dirty. TRUE
bcmSwitchControlAutoSync This instructs the SDK to store its dynamic state to the persistent storage after every API call that results in a state change. Refer to the Warm Boot documentation for more details. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCrashRecoveryMode This instructs the SDK to change the Crash Recovery operation mode possible values 0:off 1:API 2:on demand. 0/1/2
bcmSwitchCrCommit If workinging in on demand CR, use this to trigger a commit. TRUE
bcmSwitchCrLastTransactionStatus Query after a crash if last transaction went through. TRUE/FALSE
SwitchCrCouldNotRecover When working in Crash Recovery Mode, Query after A crash if program successfully recovered. TRUE/FALSE
SwitchCrTransactionStart If working in on demand CR, use this to start a new transaction. TRUE/FALSE
SwitchCrAbort If working in on demand CR, use this to abort the current transaction. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCallbackAbortOnError This controls the decision to abort or not if a user callback returns an error code. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUseGport Enable GPORT format for destination/source representation. TRUE
bcmSwitchTrillEthertype TRILL EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchTrillISISEthertype TRILL ISIS EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchTrillISISDestMacOui TRILL_ALL_ISIS_RBRIDGES Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillBroadcastDestMacOui TRILL_ALL_RBRIDGES Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillEndStationDestMacOui TRILL_ALL_ESADI_RBRIDGES Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillISISDestMacNonOui TRILL_ALL_ISIS_RBRIDGES Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Lower 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillBroadcastDestMacNonOui TRILL_ALL_RBRIDGES Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Lower 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillEndStationDestMacNonOui TRILL_ALL_ESADI_RBRIDGES Lower 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address
bcmSwitchTrillMinTtl Minimum TTL for Egress and Transit TRILL Rbridge. 0 - 63
bcmSwitchTrillTtlCheckEnable Enable TTL check for Egress TRILL Rbridge TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillTtlErrToCpu Copy TRILL TTL failure packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillHeaderErrToCpu Copy TRILL header error packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillMismatchToCpu Copy TRILL Mismatch error packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillNameMissToCpu Copy TRILL Rbridge lookup failure to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillRpfFailToCpu Copy TRILL TRILL RPF check failure to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillOptionsToCpu Copy TRILL Rbridge header Options to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillNameErrDrop Set Drop setting for TRILL packets with Ingress-name equal to Egress-name TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillRpfFailDrop Set Drop setting for TRILL multicast packets that fail RPF check TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillHeaderVersionErrDrop Set Drop Setting for TRILL frames received with a non-zero Version field. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillNameMissDrop Set Drop setting for TRILL Ingress RBridge nickname lookup failure. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillAdjacencyFailDrop Set Drop setting for TRILL adjacency failure. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrillHeaderErrDrop Set Drop Setting for TRILL header error. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUdpPktActionEnable Enable/disable the default actions for UDP packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUdpPktRedirectPbmp Replace the destination port bitmap of UDP packets if bcmSwitchUdpPktActionEnable is enabled. port bitmap
bcmSwitchUdpPktCopyToPbmp Add the destination port bitmap of UDP packets if bcmSwitchUdpPktActionEnable is enabled. port bitmap
bcmSwitchUdpPktNewTc Change the Traffic Class value of UDP packets if bcmSwitchUdpPktActionEnable is enabled. traffic class value
bcmSwitchL3TunnelIpV4ModeOnly Set Layer3-Tunnel configuration specific to IPV4_MODE. Default is IPV4_IPV6_MODE. 1
bcmSwitchL3SrcHitEnable Enables/Disables source hit bit lookup update in the L3 table TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2DstHitEnable Enables/Disables destination hit bit lookup update in the L2 table TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWESPProtocolEnable Enables/Disables parsing into Wrapped Encapsulating Security Payload (WESP) TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWESPProtocol Wrapped Encapsulating Security Payload (WESP) protocol number 0-255
bcmSwitchReservedMcastLearn Enables/Disables source MAC address learning of reserved multicast packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivEthertype NIV EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchNivPrioDropToCpu Copy packets failing NIV priority admittance to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivInterfaceMissToCpu Copy packets failing NIV forwarding lookup to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivRpfFailToCpu Copy packets failing NIV RPF check to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivTagInvalidToCpu Copy packets with invalid VNTAG to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivTagDropToCpu Copy packets with VNTAG present to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNivUntagDropToCpu Copy packets without VNTAG to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp6CompressEnable Enables/Disables IPv6 compression support in the VFP table TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp6CompressDefaultOffset Set the offset value used to extract 26-bits from the IPv6 address field of IPv6 packet 0-63
bcmSwitchGportAnyDefaultL2Learn Set default cml_flag_value for any Gport type value = BCM_PORT_LEARN_xxx
bcmSwitchGportAnyDefaultL2Move Set default cml_station_move value for any Gport type value = BCM_PORT_LEARN_xxx
bcmSwitchSetMplsEntropyLabelTtl Set MPLS Entropy-Label TTL Value 0-127
bcmSwitchSetMplsEntropyLabelPri Set MPLS Entropy-Label Priority Value 0-7
bcmSwitchSetMplsEntropyLabelOffset Set MPLS Entropy-Label HASH Offset. 0-31
bcmSwitchPonOamFailsafeState Enables/Disables MPCP fail safe TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEquipmentAlarmState Enables/Disables equipment alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPowerAlarmState Enables/Disables power alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBatteryMissingAlarmState Enables/Disables battery missing alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBatteryFailureAlarmState Enables/Disables battery failure alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBatteryVoltLowAlarmState Enables/Disables battery voltage low alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBatteryVoltLowAlarmReportThreshold Sets battery voltage low alarm report threshold 0-0xffffffff
bcmSwitchBatteryVoltLowAlarmClearThreshold Sets battery voltage low alarm clear threshold 0-0xffffffff
bcmSwitchPhysicalIntrusionAlarmState Enables/Disables physical intrusion alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSelfTestFailureAlarmState Enables/Disables selftest failure alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPonIfSwitchAlarmState Enables/Disables PON interface switchover alarm report state TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIngParseL2TunnelTermDipSipSelect Controls the values used to populate the DIP,SIP containers for L2 tunnel terminated packets TRUE/FALSE for DIP/SIP
bcmSwitchIngParseL3L4IPv4 Enable parsing of IPv4 L3/L4 headers in L2 tunnel payload TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIngParseL3L4IPv6 Enable parsing of IPv6 L3/L4 headers in L2 tunnel payload TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIngParseL2TunnelTermArp Enable parsing of payload ARP header for L2 tunnel terminated packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIngParseL2TunnelTermRarp Enable parsing of payload RARP header for L2 tunnel terminated packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSetWredJitterMask Enable setting of WRED jitter MASK WRED Jitter Mask Value
bcmSwitchL3IngressInterfaceMapSet 0 - Traditional VLAN to L3 Ingress Interface Identity mapping. (default) 1 - Configurable VLAN to L3 IIF mapping to support Strict URPF mode. L3 Interfaces (L3-IIF) for L3 Interfaces are constructed using bcm_l3_ingress_create(WITH_REPLACE flag). This mode can also be used to set different MTU values for different egress interfaces with the same VLAN. To achieve this, L3IngressInterfaceMapSet is to be set prior to the intf creation. Also, when this mode is set, the VRF is not dictated by the vlan (as opposed to the L3IngressInterfaceMapSet=0 mode). The VRF is derived from the ingress interface ID. 0/1
bcmSwitchMplsPWControlWordToCpu Enable MPLS packets with PWACH control word, to be copied to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsPWControlTypeToCpu Enable MPLS packets with other control word, to be copied to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsPWControlWord Set Control Word value 0-0xffffffff
bcmSwitchMplsPWCountPktsAll Enable count-all MPLS packets arriving on PWs TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEntropyHashSet0Offset BCM56440 Enhanced hash bits selection 0 (One of the two global configuration sets) for MPLS Entropy Label. For BCM56640, it's per port configuration and available. 0-63
bcmSwitchEntropyHashSet1Offset BCM56440 Enhanced hash bits selection 1 (One of the two global configuration sets) for MPLS Entropy Label. For BCM56640, it's unavailable. 0-63
bcmSwitchMultipathCompressBuffer Size of the L3 ECMP table defragmentation buffer. The default defragmentation buffer size is zero, and it is recommended that the defrag buffer size be set the max size of the ECMP group expected to be configured. NOTE: The defragmentation buffer reduces the total number multipath egress objects that can be configured. 0 to maximum number of paths in a L3 ECMP group.
bcmSwitchMultipathCompress Force defragmentation of L3 ECMP table. TRUE
bcmSwitchL3McastL2 if set to 0 then l2 key is <VID, DA>, if set to 1 then l2 key is <RIF/VID, DIP>. 0/1
bcmSwitchMiMTeBvidLowerRange Configure the lower limit for Traffic engineered BVID. 0-4095
bcmSwitchMiMTeBvidUpperRange Configure the upper limit for Traffic engineered BVID. 0-4095
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkAutoIncludeDisable If set, disables automatic inclusion of all members of a fabric trunk group when one member is specified as the steering destination for a remote module. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRemoteEncapsulationMode Configure an egress switch device to process remotely replicated packets per HiGig2 encapsulation instruction, instead of performing replication on the egress device. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsLabelCache Enable MPLS Label Cache. All updates to the MPLS label table will not be committed to hardware memory until the caching is disabled and bcm_switch_control_set is called with SwitchMplsLabelCommit. Only supported by caladan devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsLabelCommit Commits MPLS label table to the hardware memory. bcmSwitchMplsLabelCache must be disabled before calling this. Only supported by caladan devices. N/A
bcmSwitchLinkProvClear Enable/Disable automatic link provision clear and set relevant options. - 1 - Enable automatic link provision clear
  • 2 - Retain allow list when clearing link provision
  • 4 - Retain block list when clearing link provision
bcmSwitchEtagEthertype ETAG EtherType to match Ethertype
bcmSwitchEtagInvalidToCpu Copy packets with invalid ETAG to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEtagDropToCpu Copy packets dropped due to ETAG present to CPU. Enable/disable or set specific system port gport. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchNonEtagDropToCpu Copy packets dropped due to ETAG not present to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchExtenderRpfFailToCpu Copy packets failing Port Extender RPF check to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchExtenderInterfaceMissToCpu Copy packets failing Port Extender forwarding lookup to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPrioDropToCpu Copy packets failing priority admittance to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchExtenderMulticastLowerThreshold Lower threshold of multicast Extended Port VID 0-0x3fff
bcmSwitchExtenderMulticastHigherThreshold Higher threshold of multicast Extended Port VID 0-0x3fff
bcmSwitchL3NATEnable Enable/Disable NAT TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3DNATHairpinToCpu Send copy of DNAT hairpin packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3DNATMissToCpu Send copy of DNAT lookup miss packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3SNATMissToCpu Send copy of SNAT lookup miss packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3NatOtherToCpu Send copy of realm crossing non-TCP, non-UDP or non-ICMP packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3NatRealmCrossingIcmpToCpu Send copy of realm crossing ICMP packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3NatFragmentsToCpu Send copy of NAT fragment packets to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3NatDNATPool Hash select for DNAT pool table Same as bcmSwitchHashL3
bcmSwitchL3NatDNATPoolDual Second hash select for DNAT pool table Same as bcmSwitchHashL3
bcmSwitchShaperAdjust Per Packet adjustment for metering and rate control (generally used to account for IPG) Number of bytes to add to packet length for EFP Stage
bcmSwitchIp4Compress Compress IPv4 routing table. Memory index
bcmSwitchPolicerFairness if set, packet is considered in profile if bucket-level plus random value are above packet-size. If not set, packet is considered in profile if bucket-level is above packet-size TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTMDomain Device TM-Domain TM-Domain: 0-15
bcmSwitchMcastTrunkHashMin Minimal hushing value for a copy with a given port as destination. Copies with lower Hash values will be dropped. 0-255
bcmSwitchMcastTrunkHashMax Maximal hushing value for a copy with a given port as destination. Copies with higher Hash values will be dropped. 0-255
bcmSwitchStackRouteHistoryBitmap1 Configures Stacking route history bitmap stamping according to port profile number 1. Uses for packet pruning in Stacking system. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchStackRouteHistoryBitmap2 Configures Stacking route history bitmap stamping according to port profile number 2. Uses for packet pruning in Stacking system. 0-0xffff
bcmSwitchTrillHopCount Trill hop count 0-63
bcmSwitchPortHeaderType Sets TM Port header type. SOC_TMC_PORT_HEADER_TYPE:
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_NONE
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_ETH
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_RAW
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TM
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_PROG
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_CPU
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_STACKING
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TDM
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TDM_RAW
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_MPLS_RAW
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_INJECTED_2_PP
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TM_SSP
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TM_ENCAP
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TM_SSP_ENCAP
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_INJECTED_2
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_RCH_0
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_RCH_1
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_INJECTED_2_PP_JR1_MODE
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_INJECTED_2_JR1_MODE
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_ENCAP_EXTERNAL_CPU
  • BCM_SWITCH_PORT_HEADER_TYPE_TDM_ETH

bcmSwitchVxlanEntropyEnableIP6 Set IPv6 Flow Label for VXLAN Tunnel Entropy TRUE/FALSE

bcmSwitchEgressKeepSystemHeader Keep system headers on Tx packets for a given port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMcastTrunkIngressCommit If set, the Multicast LAG packets use the new LAG table definition for the member resolution. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMcastTrunkEgressCommit If set, the new Multicast LAG table is copied to the old one. It assumes that all the devices are using the new LAG table, after calling bcmSwitchMcastTrunkIngressCommit. TRUE/FALSE
BcmSwitchMplsShortPipe If Set device supports Short pipe only. Otherwise Pipe only. Applicable only in 88660 Device. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTraverseMode Control the traverse mode. - bcmSwitchTableUpdateNormal, // Calling traverse API e.g. l2_replace() will act in normal mode, i.e. set match rule and action and perform the replace
  • bcmSwitchTableUpdateRuleAdd, // Calling traverse API e.g. l2_replace() will add rule without perform the replace
  • bcmSwitchTableUpdateRuleClear,// clear all rules e.g. l2_replace() Calling traverse API
  • bcmSwitchTableUpdateRuleCommit // Run traverse API e.g. l2_replace() with configured rules
bcmSwitchTrunkResilientHashConfig Selects hashing polynomial for LAG Resilant Hashing - BCM_HASH_CONFIG_NONE
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC8_0x14D
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC8_0x1C3
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC8_0x1CF
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x17111
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x10491
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x155F5
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x1013D
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x13965
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x1698D
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x1105D
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x10861
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x10285
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x101a1
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x12499
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x1f801
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x172e1
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x1eb21
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_FP_DATA
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_ROUND_ROBIN
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CLOCK_BASED
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x8003
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x8011
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x8423
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x8101
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x84a1
  • BCM_HASH_CONFIG_CRC16_0x9019

bcmSwitchFcoeNpvModeEnable Enable the NPV mode TRUE/FALSE

bcmSwitchFcoeSourceBindCheckAction Action to take when Source-bind-check fails. 0 is drop (default) and 1 is ignore. 0-1
bcmSwitchFcoeSourceFpmaPrefixCheckAction Action to take when Source-fpma-prefix-check fails. 0 is drop (default) and 1 is ignore. 0-1
bcmSwitchFcoeVftHopCountExpiryToCpu Copy hopcount expired packets to CPU. 0-1
bcmSwitchFcoeVftHopCountExpiryAction Send hopcount expired packets with EOFni in FC trailer. Applicable at egress. 0-1
bcmSwitchFcoeFcEofT1Value Set numerical value for EOFt 0-255
bcmSwitchFcoeFcEofT2Value Set the numerical value for EOFt (alternate) 0-255
bcmSwitchFcoeFcEofA1Value Set the numerical value for EOFa 0-255
bcmSwitchFcoeFcEofA2Value Set the numerical value for EOFa (alternate) 0-255
