bcmSwitchIPv6ResvdMcPktDrop Multicast packets with the reserved IPv6 address should be dropped TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDirectedMirroring Enable directed mirroring mode Default value is true. This switch control cannot be set to false by user to maintain consistency in mirroring behavior across all devices. TRUE
bcmSwitchDirectedUnmarked Send directed mirror packets across HiGig links as a simple unicast TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPktAge Global MMU packet age timer setting in milliseconds 0-7162
bcmSwitchMcastFloodDefault Default multicast flood mode setting for VLAN create. VLAN multicast flood mode, see table BCM_VLAN_MCAST_FLOOD_table
bcmSwitchParityErrorToCpu Table lookup parity error packets should be sent to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3MtuFailToCpu L3 MTU fail packets should be sent to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMeterAdjust Per Packet adjustment for metering and rate control (generally used to account for IPG) Number of bytes to add to packet length
bcmSwitchMeterAdjustInterframeGap Indicate the size in Bytes of the IFG in Header-compensation for policer.
bcmSwitchHashL2 Hash select for L2 - BCM_HASH_ZERO - Always return 0 (debug only)
  • BCM_HASH_LSB - return LSB of key
  • BCM_HASH_CRC16L - Lower bits of CRC-16
  • BCM_HASH_CRC16U - Upper bits of CRC-16
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32L - Lower bits of CRC-32
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32U - Upper bits of CRC-32
bcmSwitchHashL3 Hash select for L3 Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashMultipath Hash select for Multipath - BCM_HASH_ZERO - Always return 0 (debug only)
  • BCM_HASH_LSB - return LSB of key
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32L - Lower bits of CRC-32
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32U - Upper bits of CRC-32
bcmSwitchHashControl Hash Control for L2, L3 and Multipath (ECMP/WCMP) - BCM_HASH_CONTROL_MULTIPATH_L4PORTS - Use TCP/UDP ports for Multipath hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_MULTIPATH_DIP - Use destination IP address for Multipath hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_MULTIPATH_USERDEF - User defined ECMP seed. The seed will concatenate with other sources to construct the ECMP key
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_UC_XGS2 - BCM5695-compatible unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_UC_SRCPORT - Use source port for unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_NUC_DST - Use destination MAC or IP address for non-unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_NUC_SRC - Use source MAC or IP address for non-unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_NUC_MODPORT - Use module ID and port for non-unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_ECMP_ENHANCE - Use enhanced (RTAG7) ECMP hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_TRUNK_NUC_ENHANCE - Use enhanced (RTAG7) non-unicast trunk hashing
  • BCM_HASH_CONTROL_ECMP_OVERLAY_ENHANCE - Use enhanced (RTAG7) hashing for ECMP in overlay layer
bcmSwitchFieldMultipathHashSelect Hash select for field redirected multipath frames - BCM_HASH_ZERO - Always return 0 (debug only)
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32L - Lower bits of CRC-32
  • BCM_HASH_CRC32U - Upper bits of CRC-32
  • BCM_HASH_XORL - Lower bits of key bytes xor
  • BCM_HASH_XORU - Upper bits of key bytes xor
bcmSwitchFieldMultipathHashSeed Seed value for field multipath hash selection key. Seed value.
bcmSwitchMirrorStackMode Select BCM56504, BCM5670, or BCM5675-A0-style stacking - BCM_MIRROR_STACK_MODE_XGS3 - stacking with BCM56504
  • BCM_MIRROR_STACK_MODE_XGS1 - stacking with BCM5670
  • BCM_MIRROR_STACK_MODE_XGS2 - stacking with BCM5675-A0
bcmSwitchMirrorSrcModCheck Source module ID check in BCM56504-style of mirroring TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDestPortHGTrunk Enable to use destination port in selecting egress port for HiGig trunks. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchColorSelect Select source parameter to convert into color selection. - BCM_COLOR_PRIORITY - map VLAN priority to color
  • BCM_COLOR_OUTER_CFI - map CFI to color
  • BCM_COLOR_INNER_CFI - map inner tag CFI to color
bcmSwitchModuleLoopback Enable ingress of packets with local module ID TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcModBlockMirrorCopy Enable BCM5670-compatible source module ID blocking TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcModBlockMirrorOnly Enable BCM5675-A0-compatible source module ID blocking TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashSetTflowMode BCM56960 If on, hash selection of b0/b1 is allowed regardless of th_tflow_enabled state. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashSeed0 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 hash seed 0 for enhanced hashing algorithm. 0x0-0xFFFFFFFF
bcmSwitchHashSeed1 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 hash seed 1 for enhanced hashing algorithm. 0x0-0xFFFFFFFF
bcmSwitchHashField0PreProcessEnable Enable pre-processing for BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 0 TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashField1PreProcessEnable Enable pre-processing for BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 1 TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashField0OverlayCntagRpidEnable Enable overlay of CN-tag's RPID onto hash seed 0. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashField1OverlayCntagRpidEnable Enable overlay of CN-tag's RPID onto hash seed 1. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashField0Config BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 0 configuration - BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR8 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR8
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR4 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR4
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR2 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR2
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR1 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR1
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16 - 16-bit CRC16
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_XOR16 - 16-bit XOR (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16CCITT - 16-bit CRC16 using CCITT polynomial (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32LO - Lower 16-bit of CRC32 (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32HI - Higher 16-bit of CRC32 (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_LO - Lower 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_HI - Higher 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_LO - Lower 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_HI - Higher 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
bcmSwitchHashField0Config1 BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 0 second configuration - BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR8 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR8
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR4 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR4
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR2 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR2
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR1 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR1
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16 - 16-bit CRC16
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_XOR16 - 16-bit XOR
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16CCITT - 16-bit CRC16 using CCITT polynomial
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32LO - Lower 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32HI - Higher 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_LO - Lower 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_HI - Higher 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_LO - Lower 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_HI - Higher 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
bcmSwitchHashField1Config BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 1 configuration - BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR8 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR8
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR4 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR4
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR2 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR2
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR1 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR1
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16 - 16-bit CRC16
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_XOR16 - 16-bit XOR (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16CCITT - 16-bit CRC16 using CCITT polynomial (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32LO - Lower 16-bit of CRC32 (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32HI - Higher 16-bit of CRC32 (BCM56840 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_LO - Lower 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_HI - Higher 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_LO - Lower 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_HI - Higher 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
bcmSwitchHashField1Config1 BCM56840 enhanced hash mode 1 second configuration - BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR8 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR8
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR4 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR4
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR2 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR2
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR1 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR1
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16 - 16-bit CRC16
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_XOR16 - 16-bit XOR
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16CCITT - 16-bit CRC16 using CCITT polynomial
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32LO - Lower 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32HI - Higher 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_LO - Lower 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_HI - Higher 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_LO - Lower 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_HI - Higher 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
bcmSwitchMacroFlowHashFieldConfig Enhanced macro flow mode configuration - BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR8 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR8
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR4 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR4
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR2 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR2
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16XOR1 - Upper 8-bit CRC16 + 8-bit XOR1
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16 - 16-bit CRC16
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_XOR16 - 16-bit XOR
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC16CCITT - 16-bit CRC16 using CCITT polynomial
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32LO - Lower 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32HI - Higher 16-bit of CRC32
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_LO - Lower 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_ETH_HI - Higher 16-bit of Ethernet CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_LO - Lower 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CONFIG_CRC32_KOOPMAN_HI - Higher 16-bit of Koopman CRC32 (BCM56960 only)
bcmSwitchHashSelectControl BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580 field selection control for enhanced hashing algorithm. - BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_IP4 - selection 0 for IPv4 packets
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_IP4 - selection 1 for IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_IP6 - selection 0 for IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_IP6 - selection 1 for IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_MPLS - selection 0 for MPLS pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_MPLS - selection 1 for MPLS pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_IP - selection 0 for tunnel IPv4 over IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_IP - selection 1 for tunnel IPv4 over IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_IP - selection 0 for tunnel IPv6 over IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_IP - selection 1 for tunnel IPv6 over IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE - selection 0 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE - selection 1 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE - selection 0 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE - selection 1 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_IP6 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv4 over IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_IP6 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv4 over IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_IP6 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv6 over IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_IP6 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv6 over IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_FCOE - selection 0 for FCoE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_FCOE - selection 1 for FCoE pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE_IP4 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE_IP6 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE_IP4 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP4_GRE_IP6 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv4 over GRE IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE_IP4 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE_IP6 - selection 0 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE_IP4 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE IPv4 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_TUNNEL_IP6_GRE_IP6 - selection 1 for tunnel IPv6 over GRE IPv6 pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD0_DISABLE_VXLAN - selection 0 for tunnel VXLAN pkts
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD1_DISABLE_VXLAN - selection 1 for tunnel VXLAN pkts
bcmSwitchHashIP4Field0 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv4 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_PROTOCOL - Protocol ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTL4 - Destination L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashIP4Field1 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv4 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_PROTOCOL - Protocol ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTL4 - Destination L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashIP4TcpUdpField0 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv4 TCP/UDP packets. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp4Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP4TcpUdpField1 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv4 TCP/UDP packets. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp4Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP4TcpUdpPortsEqualField0 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv4 TCP/UDP packets whose source L4 port equals to destination L4 port. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp4Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP4TcpUdpPortsEqualField1 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv4 TCP/UDP packets whose source L4 port equals to destination L4 port. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp4Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP6Field0 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv6 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_LO selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField0Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_HI selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField0Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_NXT_HDR - Next header
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTL4 - Destination L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_LO - IPv6 flow label lower 16 bits, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField0Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_HI - IPv6 flow label upper 4 bits, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField0Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_LO - IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_HI - IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_LO - IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_HI - IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashIP6Field1 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv6 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_LO selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField1Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_HI selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField1Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_NXT_HDR - Next header
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTL4 - Destination L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_LO - IPv6 flow label lower 16 bits, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField1Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_FLOWLABEL_HI - IPv6 flow label upper 4 bits, reusing BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT selection controlled by bcmSwitchHashField1Ip6FlowLabel
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_LO - IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_HI - IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_LO - IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_HI - IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashIP6TcpUdpField0 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv6 TCP/UDP packets. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp6Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP6TcpUdpField1 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv6 TCP/UDP packets. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp6Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP6TcpUdpPortsEqualField0 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for IPv6 TCP/UDP packets whose source L4 port equals to destination L4 port. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp6Field0
bcmSwitchHashIP6TcpUdpPortsEqualField1 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for IPv6 TCP/UDP packets whose source L4 port equals to destination L4 port. Same as bcmSwitchHashIp6Field0
bcmSwitchHashField0Ip6FlowLabel Enable flow label based hash field selection 0 for IPv6 packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashField1Ip6FlowLabel Enable flow label based hash field selection 1 for IPv6 packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashL2Field0 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for L2 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_ETHER_TYPE - Ether type
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_LO - MAC destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_MI - MAC destination address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_HI - MAC destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_LO - MAC source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_MI - MAC source address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_HI - MAC source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashL2Field1 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for L2 packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_ETHER_TYPE - Ether type
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_LO - MAC destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_MI - MAC destination address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_HI - MAC destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_LO - MAC source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_MI - MAC source address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_HI - MAC source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashMPLSField0 BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580 enhanced hash field selection 0 for MPLS packets. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_LO - IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_HI - IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_LO - IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_HI - IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_RSVD_LABELS - Reserved second label, top label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label

  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port

  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits

  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashL3MPLSField1 BCM56634/BCM56524/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for L3 MPLS payload. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_PROTOCOL - Protocol ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTL4 - Destination L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCL4 - Source L4 port
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)
bcmSwitchHashMPLSUseLabelStack BCM56440/BCM56640/BCM56560/BCM56970 If there are more than 3 labels, label stack (up to 5 labels) is used for hashing else Top 3 MPLS labels + payload IPV4/IPv6 fields will be selected for hashing. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashMPLSExcludeGAL BCM56450/BCM56560 To exclude GAL label from hash computation TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField0 BCM56634/BCM56524 enhanced hash field selection 0 for MPLS tunnel headers. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_LO - IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_HI - IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_LO - IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_HI - IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_RSVD_LABELS - Reserved second label, top label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField0 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for MPLS tunnel headers. - BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_3RD_LABEL - Third label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_LABELS_4MSB - Most significant 4 bits of top, second, and third label.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField0 BCM56440/BCM56640/BCM56560/BCM56970 enhanced hash field selection 0 for MPLS tunnel headers if bcmSwitchHashMPLSUseLabelStack is set and packet has more than 3 labels. - BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_3RD_LABEL_4MSB_5TH_LABEL - Third label or 4 most significant bits of 5th label.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_IP6SRC_LO_4MSB_4TH_LABEL - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits or 4th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_IP6SRC_HI_4MSB - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits or 4 most significant bits of 1st,2nd,3rd labels.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_IP6DST_LO_5TH_LABEL - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits or 5th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_IP6DST_HI_4TH_LABEL - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits or 4th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_LABELS_4MSB_3RD_LABEL - Most significant 4 bits of top, second, third labels or 3rd label alone.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField1 BCM56634/BCM56524 enhanced hash field selection 1 for MPLS tunnel headers. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_VLAN - VLAN ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_LO - IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6DST_HI - IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_LO - IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_IP6SRC_HI - IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_RSVD_LABELS - Reserved second label, top label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField1 BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 1 for MPLS tunnel headers. - BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_3RD_LABEL - Third label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_LO - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_HI - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_LO - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_HI - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_LABELS_4MSB - Most significant 4 bits of top, second, and third label.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier
bcmSwitchHashMPLSTunnelField1 BCM56440/BCM56640/BCM56560/BCM56970 enhanced hash field selection 1 for MPLS tunnel headers if bcmSwitchHashMPLSUseLabelStack is set and packet has more than 3 labels. - BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_3RD_LABEL_4MSB_5TH_LABEL - Third label or 4 most significant bits of 5th label.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_IP6SRC_LO_4MSB_4TH_LABEL - IPv4 source address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address lower 16 bits or 4th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4SRC_IP6SRC_HI_4MSB - IPv4 source address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed source address upper 16 bits or 4 most significant bits of 1st,2nd,3rd labels.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_IP6DST_LO_5TH_LABEL - IPv4 destination address lower 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed destination address lower 16 bits or 5th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_IP4DST_IP6DST_HI_4TH_LABEL - IPv4 destination address upper 16 bits or IPv6 collapsed destination address upper 16 bits or 4th label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_LABELS_4MSB_3RD_LABEL - Most significant 4 bits of top, second, third labels or 3rd label alone.
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_2ND_LABEL - Second label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_TOP_LABEL - Top label
  • BCM_HASH_MPLS_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier
bcmSwitchHashMIMTunnelField0 BCM56634/BCM56524/BCM56840 enhanced hash field selection 0 for MAC-in-MAC tunnel headers. - BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTMOD - Destination module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCMOD - Source module ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_SRCPORT - Source port ID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_LOOKUP_ID_LO - Lower 16 bits of the ISID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_LOOKUP_ID_HI - Upper 8 bits of the ISID
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_LO - MAC destination address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_MI - MAC destination address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACDA_HI - MAC destination address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_LO - MAC source address lower 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_MI - MAC source address middle 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_MACSA_HI - MAC source address upper 16 bits
  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_CNTAG_FLOW_ID - Congestion notification tag flow identifier (BCM56840 only)

  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_DSTPORT - Destination port ID

  • BCM_HASH_FIELD_LOAD_BALANCE - Load balance ID (HiGig2 only)
bcmSwitchHashUseFlowSelTrunkUc Enable flow based hash selection for Trunk unicast. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashUseFlowSelEcmp Enable flow based hash selection for ECMP. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTrunkHashSet0UnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for unicast trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_TRUNK_UC, OFFSET_TRUNK_UC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_TRUNK_UC fields NOTE (BCM56860/BCM56960): for all bcmSwitch.*Hash.*Offset = SUB_SET + OFFSET
  1. SUB_SEL: 0(HASH_A0), 16(HASH_B0), 32(LBN), 36(DPORT), 52(LBID), 60(LBID), 68(HASH_A1), 84(HASH_B1)
  2. OFFSET : Offset of LSB for picking the hash value from the subset selected
  3. CONCATENATE: Determines whether the hash outputs from RTAG7 will be treated as a single 64 bit value or as four 16 bit fields.
0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchTrunkHashSet1UnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for unicast trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_TRUNK_UC, OFFSET_TRUNK_UC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_TRUNK_UC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchTrunkHashSet0NonUnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for non-unicast trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_TRUNK_NONUC, OFFSET_TRUNK_NONUC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_TRUNK_NONUC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchTrunkHashSet1NonUnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for non-unicast trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_TRUNK_NONUC, OFFSET_TRUNK_NONUC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_TRUNK_NONUC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchTrunkFailoverHashOffset BCM56860/BCM56960 Enhanced hash selections for trunk failover. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_PLFS, OFFSET_PLFS, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_TRUNK_PLFS fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkHashSet0UnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for unicast fabric trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_HG_TRUNK_UC, OFFSET_HG_TRUNK_UC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_HG_TRUNK_UC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkHashSet1UnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for unicast fabric trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_HG_TRUNK_UC, OFFSET_HG_TRUNK_UC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_HG_TRUNK_UC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkHashSet0NonUnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for non-unicast fabric trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_HG_TRUNK_NONUC, OFFSET_HG_TRUNK_NONUC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_HG_TRUNK_NONUC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)
bcmSwitchFabricTrunkHashSet1NonUnicastOffset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840/BCM56860/BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for non-unicast fabric trunking. The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_HG_TRUNK_NONUC, OFFSET_HG_TRUNK_NONUC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_HG_TRUNK_NONUC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)

The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_DLB_HGT, OFFSET_DLB_HGT, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_DLB_HGT fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)

The control set and get RTAG7_PORT_BASED_HASH memory's SUB_SEL_LBID_UC, OFFSET_LBID_UC, and CONCATENATE_HASH_FIELDS_LBID_UC fields 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840,BCM56860,BCM56960),>100 concat mode (BCM56860,BCM56960)

bcmSwitchMacroFlowEcmpHashConcatEnable Enable hash concatenation for ecmp macro flow. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacroFlowEcmpUnderlayHashConcatEnable Enable hash concatenation for ecmp level 2 macro flow. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacroFlowLoadBalanceHashConcatEnable Enable hash concatenation for Load balance macro flow. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacroFlowTrunkHashConcatEnable Enable hash concatenation for Trunk macro flow. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacroFlowHigigTrunkHashConcatEnable Enable hash concatenation for HiGig Trunk macro flow. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMacroFlowECMPHashSeed Set Hash seed for ecmp macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowECMPUnderlayHashSeed Set Hash seed for ecmp level 2 macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowLoadBalanceHashSeed Set Hash Seed for Load balance macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowTrunkHashSeed Set Hash Seed for Trunk macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchMacroFlowHigigTrunkHashSeed Set Hash Seed for HiGig Trunk macro flow. It doesn't support get, because the seed is scrambled. Random seed value 0x1-0xFFFFFF
bcmSwitchECMPHashSet0Offset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for ECMP. Here, arg represents the offset of one wide hash value which is concatenated by various hash chunks sequentially. For BCM56850, these hash chunks are arranged as 16-bit hash A0, 16-bit hash B0, 4-bit LBN, 16-bit DPORT, 8-bit LBID, 8-bit SW1 LBID, 16-bit hash A1, 16-bit hash B1, 64-bit concatenated hash B1_B0_A1_A0, 4-bit LBN, 16-bit DPORT, 8-bit LBID and 8-bit SW1 LBID. For a given arg, both of the msb and chunk are determined. 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840), >100 concat mode (BCM56640,BCM56850)
bcmSwitchECMPHashSet1Offset BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580/BCM56840 enhanced hash bits selection 1 for ECMP. 0-48, 0-99 (BCM56840)
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayHashSet0Offset BCM56960 enhanced hash bits selection 0 for ECMP Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPVxlanHashOffset BCM56850 Enhanced hash select for VxLAN ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayVxlanHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for VxLAN ECMP Level 2 hashing. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPL2GreHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for L2Gre ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayL2GreHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for L2Gre ECMP Level 2 hashing. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPTrillHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for TRILL ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchECMPUnderlayTrillHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for TRILL ECMP hashing at Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
bcmSwitchECMPMplsHashOffset BCM56850/BCM56640 Enhanced hash select for MPLS ECMP hashing. 0-99
bcmSwitchVirtualPortDynamicHashOffset BCM56850 Enhanced hash select for Virtual port Aggregation group. 0-99
bcmSwitchVirtualPortUnderlayDynamicHashOffset BCM56960 Enhanced hash select for Virtual port Aggregation group at Level 2. 0-99, >100 concat mode
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillPayloadSelect0 Set hash control to select TRILL payload L2/L3 fields for Hash Block A. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L2: Inner L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillPayloadSelect1 Set hash control to select TRILL payload L2/L3 fields for Hash Block B. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L2: Inner L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillTunnelSelect0 Set hash control to select TRILL Tunnel L2/L3 fields for Hash Block A. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_OUTER_L2: Outer L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_TUNNEL_INNER_L2: Tunnel and inner l2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashTrillTunnelSelect1 Set hash control to select TRILL Tunnel L2/L3 fields for Hash Block B. - BCM_HASH_SELECT_OUTER_L2: Outer L2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_TUNNEL_INNER_L2: Tunnel and inner l2 fields
  • BCM_HASH_SELECT_INNER_L3: Inner L3 fields
cw bcmSwitchHashIP6AddrCollapseSelect0 Hash Control to collapse IPV6 addresses for hash block A. - BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_XOR
  • BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_LSB
cw bcmSwitchHashIP6AddrCollapseSelect1 Hash Control to collapse IPV6 addresses for hash block B. - BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_XOR
  • BCM_HASH_IP6_COLLAPSE_LSB
cw bcmSwitchHashIPSecSelect0 Set hash control to select outer L4_SRC/DST_PORT or IPV6 SPI for hash block A. - BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_OUTER_L4_PORT
  • BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_SPI
cw bcmSwitchHashIPSecSelect1 Set hash control to select outer L4_SRC/DST_PORT or IPV6 SPI for hash block B. - BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_OUTER_L4_PORT
  • BCM_HASH_IPSEC_SELECT_SPI
cw bcmSwitchPrependTagEnable Enable Prepend tag per Port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPortEgressBlockL2 Apply egress mask port blocking on L2 traffic TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchPortEgressBlockL3 Apply egress mask port blocking on L3 traffic TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRemoteLearnTrust Set the do not learn bit in HiGig header and act on it upon receive. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchAlternateStoreForward Configure faster packet store and forward mechanism. Also known as cut-through forwarding. - BCM56850 :
  • TRUE / FALSE (Cut-through / Store-And-Forward) Only 40G port supports Cut-through mode, if this port is configured in oversubscription mode.- BCM56960 :
  • bcmPortAsfModeStoreAndForward [0] Store and Forward (SAF) mode
  • bcmPortAsfModeSameSpeed [1] Cut-thru forwarding between same speed ports
  • bcmPortAsfModeSlowToFast [2] Cut-thru forwarding between slower to faster speed ports
  • bcmPortAsfModeFastToSlow [3] Cut-thru forwarding between faster to slower speed ports BCM56960 supports aforementioned additional modes of cut-through.
bcmSwitchIpmcGroupMtu For ingress MTU check for all IPMC groups TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSourceMacZeroDrop If set, packets which have a MAC SA of all zeroes will be dropped. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBpduInvalidVlanDrop BPDU packets are dropped or forwarded when the packet going out contains an invalid VLAN. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMirrorInvalidVlanDrop Mirror-to-port packets are dropped or forwarded when the packet going out contains an invalid VLAN. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMirrorPktChecksEnable All packet checks are enabled or disabled for mirrored packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUniformUcastTrunkDistribution Improve the trunk distribution for unicast trunking with non power of two number of trunk ports. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUniformFabricTrunkDistribution Improve the trunk distribution for HiGig trunking with non power of two number of trunk ports. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanL3Route Enable L2 switching of IP Multicast (IPMC) packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruning When FALSE, allow both L2 and L3 copies of a packet to go out on a physical port if it happens to be a member of both the L2 and L3 bitmaps of the replication group. When TRUE (default), only the L3 copy goes out. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruningOverride This is only relevant when bcmSwitchIpmcSameVlanPruning is TRUE. When set to TRUE, allows both L2 and L3 copies of a packet to go out on a physical port, if the port happens to be a member of both the L2 and L3 bitmaps of the replication group. When FALSE, only the L3 copy goes out. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcReplicationSharing When TRUE, allow a linked list of VLANs or L3 interfaces to be shared among multiple {IPMC group, egress port} entities in IPMC replication. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcReplicationAvailabilityThreshold If the IPMC replication table's available space falls below this threshold, conservation of replication table space takes higher priority than distribution of IPMC traffic among trunk members by hashing. This threshold is specified in whole percentages. 0-100
bcmSwitchL3IngressMode 0 - Traditional L3 Ingress interface management. (default) 1 - Advanced L3 Ingress Interface(L3-IIF) management. L3 Interfaces (L3-IIF) for MPLS and L3 Tunnels are constructed using bcm_l3_ingress_create(). 0/1
bcmSwitchL3HostAsRouteReturnValue 0 - Traditional bcm_l3_host_add API return value. (default) 0x01 - 0xFF - Application to specify 8-bit return value for bcm_l3_host_add API with BCM_L3_HOST_AS_ROUTE flag. If prefix gets added to DEFIP table, then return value=<8-bit specified value> If prefix gets added to HOST table, then return value=0 0/1
bcmSwitchL3EgressMode 0 - Traditional egress management. (default). Nexthop destinations are constructed and shared dynamically through destination related members in bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t. 1 - Application controls egress management. Nexthop destinations are constructed using bcm_l3_egress_create() and bcm_l3_egress_multipath_create(). When in this mode, the bcm_l3_host_t.l3a_intf member and bcm_l3_route_t.l3a_intf member must be a bcm_if_t that was created by bcm_l3_egress_create() or bcm_l3_egress_multipath_create(). The following members of bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t are ignored:
  • l3a_nexthop_mac
  • l3a_modid
  • l3a_port_tgid
  • l3a_vid The following members of bcm_mpls_switch_t are ignored for LSR.
  • next_mac
  • next_vlan
  • next_mod
  • next_port
  • next_trunk
  • push_label1 The following members of bcm_mpls_switch_t are ignored for LER.
  • next_mac
  • next_vlan
  • dst_mod
  • dst_port
  • dst_trunk The following flags for bcm_l3_host_t and bcm_l3_route_t are ignored:
  • BCM_L3_L2ONLY
  • BCM_L3_TGID
  • BCM_L3_L2TOCPU
  • BCM_L3_MUTLIPATH
0/1
bcmSwitchUnknownIpmcAsMcast If set, threat unknown IPMC as L2 Mcast TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelUnknownIpmcDrop If set, drop unknown IPMC for incoming tunnel. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDhcpLearn If set, learn MACSA of DHCP packet. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcTtl1ToCpu If set, copy L3 multicast with TTL 1 to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UcastTtl1ToCpu If set, copy L3 unicast with TTL 1 to CPU TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDosAttackFlagZeroSeqZero, If enable, drop packet with TCP sequence number and all control bits are zero. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDosAttackSynFrag If enable, drop TCP SYN packet with source port 0-1023 for the first segment. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrExtLengthEnable If disable, ignore HDR_EXT_LEN field in HiGig+ header in parsing HiGig+ header. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp4McastL2DestCheck If enable, check for lower 23 bits of MACDA matches with lower 23 bits of destination IP address of IPv4 multicast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIp6McastL2DestCheck If enable, check for lower 32-bits of MACDA matches with lower 32-bits of destination IP address of IPv6 multicast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3InterfaceUrpfEnable If enabled, URPF check is per L3_IIF. If disabled, URPF check is per physical port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3TunnelUrpfMode Reverse path check mode for unicast tunneled packets. - BCM_SWITCH_URPF_DISABLE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_LOOSE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_STRICT
bcmSwitchL3TunnelUrpfDefaultRoute If enable, tunneled packets will be accepted even when reverse route is a default gateway. Relevant only if URPF check is enabled for tunneled packets. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfFailToCpu Enable trap URPF fail packets to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfRouteEnable Enable route lookup for URPF check. Enabling or disabling this switch control will erase device route table completely. Enabling this control will reduce total number of routes device can accommodate by 50%. Half of the routes will be allocated to reverse source Disabling this control will restore route table size back to normal. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3UrpfRouteEnableExternal Enable route lookup for URPF check. If L3 prefixes are completely within external-TCAM, enabling or disabling this switch control will not erase any of device route table entries installed.
bcmSwitchL3UrpfMode Per port reverse path check mode for unicast packets. - BCM_SWITCH_URPF_DISABLE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_LOOSE
  • BCM_SWITCH_URPF_STRICT
bcmSwitchL3UrpfDefaultRoute If enable, unicast packets will be accepted even when reverse route is a default gateway. Relevant only if URPF check is enabled for unicast packets on the port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3Max128BV6Entries Sets the maximum number of 128B V6 LPM routes. Default value depends on the configuration variable num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries.When bcm_l3_init is called, maximum number of 128B V6 entries is read from the configuration variable num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries. If this variable is not set, then the default value depends on the value of the configuration variable ipv6_lpm_128b_enable. If ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is 1, then the default value is 2048. If ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is 0, then the default valu e is 0. if ipv6_lpm_128b_enable is not defined as well then the default value is 2048. Please note that if bcmSwitchL3Max128BV6Entries is set to a value different from the value of num_ipv6_lpm_128b_entries, then Level1 warmboot recovery can cause SER errors. However Level2 warmboot recovery works fine. For Trident2 and Triumph3, valid range is 0-4096. Value should be multiple of 2. Otherwise it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 2
bcmSwitchIngressRateLimitIncludeIFG Per port, add additional bytes to ingress metering for each packet to account for IFG. Some devices may round off the given value to a restricted set. 0-63
bcmSwitchRateLimitLinear If set, shaping and egress metering limits are linear. Some systems allow non-linear limits when disabled. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashL2Dual Second hash select for L2. If the value is not equal to the setting for bcmSwitchHashL2, then the L2 host table is placed in dual-hash mode. If the value is set equal to bcmSwitchHashL2, dual-hash mode is disabled. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashL3Dual Second hash select for L3. If the value is not equal to the setting for bcmSwitchHashL3, then the L3 host table is placed in dual-hash mode. If the value is set equal to bcmSwitchHashL3, dual-hash mode is disabled. Same as bcmSwitchHashL3
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepth Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode. When dual hash mode is enabled on a table, this control value will enable software-assisted rearrangement of the hash table upon hardware insert failure. The driver will attempt to rearrange the entries in the table to allow the insertion of the new entry. The driver will be more aggressive (and potentially less responsive during insert attempts) as this value increases. While no maximum value is indicated, any value greate r than 3 will consume significant system resources. A value of zero will disable software rearrangement. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthL2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthMpls Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthEgressVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for egress VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthL3 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthIngVpVlanMember Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for ING_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP table. >=0
bcmSwitchHashDualMoveDepthEgrVpVlanMember Maximum levels checked for moving entries in dual hash mode for EGR_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP table. >=0
bcmSwitchHashL2DualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashL3DualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMPLSDualLeastFull Use least full bank in dual hash MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepth Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode. When different hash modes are configured on multi bank hash tables, this control value will enable software-assisted rearrangement of the hash table upon hardware insert failure. The driver will attempt to rearrange the entries in the table to allow the insertion of the new entry. The driver will be more aggressive (and potentially less responsive during insert attempts) as this value increases. While no maximum value is indicated, any value greater than 3 will consume significant system resources. A value of zero will disable software rearrangement. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlanTranslate1 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN XLATE_1 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthVlanTranslate2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for VLAN XLATE_2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthMpls Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for MPLS tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlan Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlanTranslate1 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN XLATE_1 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthEgressVlanTranslate2 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for egress VLAN XLATE_2 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthExactMatch Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for FPEM tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL3 Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L3 tables. >=0
bcmSwitchHashMultiMoveDepthL3Tunnel` Maximum levels checked for moving entries in multi bank hash mode for L3 Tunnel tables. >=0
bcmSwitchVrfMax Maximum Virtual Routing and Forwarding ID for the device. By default it is preset to a maximum supported VRF value which might be changed to desired value less than maximum and represents power of two minus one. 2^x - 1
bcmSwitchFailoverStackTrunk Is Read-only and indicates if HW support exists for Failover detection on Stack ports TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFailoverEtherTrunk Is Read-only and indicates if HW support exists for Failover detection on Ether ports TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSharedVlanEnable Enable shared VLAN learning. This is different from the older shared VLAN mechanism which specifies a global shared VLAN ID (enabled using bcm_vlan_control_set, with bcmVlanShared and bcmVlanSharedID). This newer mechanism allows a shared VLAN ID to be specified for each VLAN (see bcm_vlan_control_vlan_set). TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSharedVlanL2McastEnable Use shared VLAN ID for L2 multicast lookup TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFlood Multicast flood mode setting used in the HiGig Header. This setting is always used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig (except BCM5660x). For other multicast packets, this setting is only used if bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFloodOverride is enabled. Otherwise, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. HiGig multicast flood mode, see table BCM_VLAN_MCAST_FLOOD_table
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFloodOverride If set, the multicast flood mode specified by bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastFlood is used for non-IPMC packets sent over HiGig. If not set, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFlood IPMC multicast flood mode setting used in the HiGig Header (BCM5660x only). This setting is used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig if bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFloodOverride is enabled. Otherwise, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. IPMC HiGig multicast flood mode, see table BCM_VLAN_MCAST_FLOOD_table
bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFloodOverride If set, the multicast flood mode specified by bcmSwitchHgHdrIpMcastFlood is used for IPMC packets sent over HiGig (BCM5660x only). If not set, the per-VLAN multicast flood mode setting is used. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSTPBlockedFieldBypass If the ingress port's spanning tree state is in blocked state, then the FP is disabled when this control is set to TRUE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2PortBlocking Enable selective port blocking per MAC address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngress Hash select for Ingress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngressDual Secondary Hash select for Ingress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashIpfixIngress
bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgress Hash select for Egress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashL2
bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgressDual Secondary Hash select for Egress IPFIX. Same as bcmSwitchHashIpfixEgress
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastVlanRange Allowed range of broadcast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchHgHdrMcastL2Range Allowed range of multicast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchHgHdrL3L2Range Allowed range of IP multicast indices in HiGig2 headers 0x0-0xFFFF
bcmSwitchMcastL2Range Allowed range of multicast indices in device tables 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchL3L2Range Allowed range of IP multicast indices in device tables 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchControlPortConfigInstall Install new port configuration. For XCore/Caladan3 device only. 0x0-0x1fff
bcmSwitchAutoQueues Auto queue configuration mode on initialization. For XCore devices only the Get API is valid. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2McastAllRouterPortsAddEnable Enable addition of all-router ports to every L2 multicast entry TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchKeepEgressRtHdr Leave XCore Egress Route Header on packets for a given port. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFieldCache Enable caching of Rule table or classification entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFieldCommit Flush the cached Rule table or classification entries to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcCache Enable caching of IP Multicast S,G entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcCommit Flush the cached IP Multicast table entries to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2Cache Enable caching of MAC address entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2Commit Flush the cached MAC address table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2AgeDelete Enable deletion of MAC addresses during aging scan. The default value is TRUE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2AgeScan Scan all MAC addresses and decrement age-status. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HostCache Enable caching of L3 Host table entries TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HostCommit Flush the cached L3 Host table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3RouteCache Enable caching of L3 Route table entries. Will not be restored after warmboot. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3RouteCommit Flush the cached L3 Route table to hardware TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchBypassMode Enable skipping some switch features for improved latency. - BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_NONE
  • BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_L3_ONLY
  • BCM_SWITCH_BYPASS_L3_AND_FP
bcmSwitchStgInvalidToCpu Copy to CPU packets going out on port with STG state not forwarding TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpu Copy to CPU packets on egress with VLAN translation miss if expected to hit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3PktErrToCpu Copy to CPU Packets with IP length field is longer than the actual packet length TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpu Copy to CPU packets with L2 MTU Failure. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpu Copy to CPU packets with Split horizon or SVP pruning (SVP==DVP) failure TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpu Copy to CPU packets with incoming WLAN SVP which did not arrive on the expected tunnel TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchDrop Drop/Do not forward packets with incoming WLAN SVP which did not arrive on the expected tunnel TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpu Copy to CPU WLAN packets that have a SVP miss TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMplsCtrlPktToCpu Copy to CPU MPLS control packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchInvalidTpidToCpu Copy to CPU Invalid tag protocol ID packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchFlowSelectMissToCpu Copy to CPU packets that miss flow selection TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HdrMismatchToCpu Copy to CPU L3 header mismatch packets TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchUnknownVlanToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchUnknownVlanToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressStgInvalidToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchEgressStgInvalidToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchVlanTranslateEgressMissToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchTunnelErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3HeaderErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchL3HeaderErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEgressL3PktErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchL3PktErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpmcTtlErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that match bcmSwitchIpmcTtlErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchMtuFailureToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchHgHdrErrToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchHgHdrErrToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchSrcKnockoutToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchWlanTunnelMismatchToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpuCosq Sets the CPU CoS queue through which the traffic will flow (default 0) for packets that matches bcmSwitchWlanPortMissToCpu TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpfixRateViolationDataInsert Allow to insert new IPFIX flow entry when flow setup rate exceeds the configured rate limit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIpfixRateViolationPersistent Do not allow to change flow setup rate status of existing flows. When a new flow is established, flow setup rate status is recorded according to whether the new flow setup rate of that time exceeds the configured rate limit TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchTunnelIp4IdShared If set to FALSE, the IPv4 ID space can be selected on a per tunnel basis, otherwise it is the same across all tunnels. Default is FALSE wherever supported (BCM56634 and BCM56524). TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientAuthorizeAll If set, all WLAN clients are authorized and will disable WLAN client lookup. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56640. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientAuthPendingToCpu If set, packets from unauthorized wireless clients are sent to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientUnauthToCpu If set, unauthorized clients are sent to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientRoamedOutErrorToCpu If set, roamed out wireless clients' error packets are sent to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientSrcMacMissToCpu Enable for copy to CPU upon a wireless client database SA lookup miss. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchWlanClientDstMacMissToCpu Enable for copy to CPU upon a wireless client database DA lookup miss. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamHdrErrToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an OAM header error. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnknownVerToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an OAM version number not equal to 0. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnknownVerDrop Enable drop for an OAM version number not equal to 0. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamUnexpectedPktToCpu Enable for copy to CPU for an unexpected OAM MDL value. The default value is FALSE. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamCcmToCpu Enable switching an unexpected MEPID or Interval to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamXconCcmToCpu Enable switching CCM with low MDL or unexpected MAID to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamXconOtherToCpu Enable switching other than CCM OAM PDU with low OAM MDL value to CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56440 series of devices. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchOamOlpHeaderAdd Enable or disable OLP header addition to OAM packets copied to CPU. OLP header addition is enabled by default for OAM packets. Please note that Embedded applications such as Ethernet LM/DM and MPLS LM/DM will not work correctly if OLP header addition is disabled. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL3SrcBindFailToCpu If set, packets with source MAC-SIP binding check failures are copied to the CPU. The default value is FALSE. Supported on BCM56634 and BCM56524. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchLayeredQoSResolution If set to TRUE, enable layered QoS resolution. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCustomerQueuing Enable customer domain queuing. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchCosqStatThreshold Sets Statistics Threshold to ACE-TCE Mode. 0,25-75%
bcmSwitchCosqStatInterval Sets background ejection Statistics Interval in ms. Min of 0. Max depends on clock rate of the chip. For 400MHz, its 10737ms.
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentLowerRange1 Configure the Port Independent Lower MPLS Label for Range-1. The default value is 0. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentUpperRange1 Configure the Port Independent Upper MPLS Label for Range-1. The default value is 2^20 - 1. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentLowerRange2 Configure the Port Independent Lower MPLS Label for Range-2. The default value is 0. 0x0-0xFFFFF
bcmSwitchMplsPortIndependentUpperRange2 Configure the Port Independent Upper MPLS Label for Range-2. The default value is 2^20 - 1. 0x0-0xFFFFF

bcmSwitchPFCClass2McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 2 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840
bcmSwitchPFCClass3McastQueue Multicast queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 3 packet is received. Multicast queue group gport on BCM56840

bcmSwitchPFCClass7DestmodQueue Multiple queue to suspend when a Priority Flow Control class 7 packet is received. Unicast queue group gport on BCM56840

bcmSwitchCustomOuterUdpDstPort2 Outer UDP Dest Port 2 used for extracting packet fields in custom applications 16-bit number

bcmSwitchSRPDestMacOui Multiple Stream Registration Protocol Upper 3 bytes of MAC address to match Upper 3 bytes of MAC address

bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassBPktPrio Set Priority for the Class B class B priority
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassExeptionAPktPrio Set Remapping Priority for the exception packets in Class A class A priority
bcmSwitchTimeSyncClassExeptionBPktPrio Set Remapping Priority for the exception packets in Class B class B priority
bcmSwitchGvrpToCpu CPU port is the destination port of GVRP frame. 1
bcmSwitchGmrpToCpu CPU port is the destination port of GMRP frame. 1
bcmSwitchL3DefipMultipathCountUpdate Enable this control to update all associated ECMP_COUNT within L3_DEFIP, when ECMP changes occur through bcm_multipath_egress_xxx API Applicable for pre Firebolt-2 devices. 1
bcmSwitchL2McIdxRetType When set to 1, L2 multicast API will return multicast index as bcm_multicast_t instead of hardware multicast index. 1
bcmSwitchL3McIdxRetType When set to 1, IP multicast API will return multicast index as bcm_multicast_t instead of hardware multicast index. 1
bcmSwitchMcastSaDrop Drop the packet if the SA is mcast address. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchJumboFrameDrop Drop the Jumbo frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDroppedJumboFrameDisLearn No learn on the dropped Jumbo frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchRangeErrDrop Drop the range error frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDroppedRangeErrDisLearn No learn on the dropped range error frame. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchArpDhcpToCpu Packet with ARP or DHCP to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchIgmpMldToCpu Packet with IGMP or MLD protocol type to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchLinkDownInfoSkip When set to 1, Link status changes notification will not retrieve port information before calling registered callback. Only applies to down links; up links retrieve port information irrespective of this switch control. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchDestMacZeroDrop If set, packets which have a MAC DA of all zeroes will be dropped. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchL2SourceDiscardMoveToCpu If set, packets which have a MAC SA discard configuration will be sent to CPU. TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchServiceTpidReplace If set, TPID will be replaced in Service Delimiting SD-TAG (Supported only for Triumph2 (5663x), Enduro (5633x), and Trident (5684x)) TRUE/FALSE
bcmSwitchEEEPipelineTime Time for MAC to ensure that the egress pipeline is empty prior to the assertion of the LPI control signal. system clock cycles
bcmSwitchEEEGlobalCongestionThreshold If this threshold is exceeded, EEE is disabled for all ports. buffer cell size
bcmSwitchFiltersControlList For get only. To report the supported Filter bypass control items with bitmap format. - BCM_FILTER_NONE
  • BCM_FILTER_RX_CRCCHK
  • BCM_FILTER_DOS_TOCPU
  • BCM_FILTER_STP_USERADDR
  • BCM_FILTER_STP_MAC0X

  • BCM_FILTER_VLAN_RSV_MCAST

  • BCM_FILTER_EAP_MAC_0X
  • BCM_FILTER_EAP_BPDU

  • BCM_FILTER_RX_CRCCHK

  • BCM_LED_FUNC_PHYLED4

  • BCM_L2_INGRESS_DIST
