[in,out]unitUnit number.

◆ bcm_switch_encap_get()

int bcm_switch_encap_get ( int  unit,
bcm_if_t  encap_id,
bcm_switch_encap_info_t *  encap_info 
)

Get the configuration of the encap object with the given encap_id.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]encap_id
[in,out]encap_info

◆ bcm_switch_encap_info_t_init()

void bcm_switch_encap_info_t_init ( bcm_switch_encap_info_t *  encap_info)

Initialize a bcm_switch_encap_info_t structure.

Initialize an encapsulated info parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_encap_info_t structure, and bcm_switch_encap_info_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]encap_info(IN/OUT) Encapsulation info parameters.
Return values
VOID

◆ bcm_switch_encap_set()

int bcm_switch_encap_set ( int  unit,
bcm_if_t  encap_id,
bcm_switch_encap_info_t *  encap_info 
)

Modify the configuration of the encap object with the given encap_id.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]encap_id
[in,out]encap_info

◆ bcm_switch_encap_traverse()

int bcm_switch_encap_traverse ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_encap_traverse_cb  cb_fn,
void *  user_data 
)

Traverse all created encapsulation objects and call callback function for each allocated entry.

This API traverse over all created encapsulation objects for all service types and call provided callback function with matched entry. Whereas Callback function syntax is:

typedef int (*bcm_switch_encap_traverse_cb)(
int unit,
bcm_if_t encap_id,
bcm_switch_encap_info_t *encap_info,
void *user_data);
Parameters:
unit Unit number.
encap_id Encapsulation object ID (OUT).
encap_info Encapsulation info (OUT).
user_data User data to be passed to callback function (OUT).
Parameters
[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]cb_fnUser specified callback function.
[in,out]user_dataUser specified cookie.

◆ bcm_switch_event_control_get()

int bcm_switch_event_control_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_event_t  event,
bcm_switch_event_control_t  type,
uint32 *  value 
)

Get event control.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]eventThe type of switch event (e.g. device interrupt)
[in,out]typeThe event feature/action
[in,out]valueThe configured value for the specified control, e.g. '1' for mask enabled , '0' for mask disabled.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_event_control_set()

int bcm_switch_event_control_set ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_event_t  event,
bcm_switch_event_control_t  type,
uint32  value 
)

Set event control.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]eventThe type of switch event (e.g. device interrupt)
[in,out]typeThe event feature/action
bcm_switch_event_control_t
Field BCM Type Description
event_id int Event identifier, e.g. for interrupt event, device-specific enumerator per interrupt-cause.
index int If multi-instance blocks represent the specific block index.
action bcm_switch_event_control_action_t The action to perform on the indicated event.
bcm_switch_event_control_action_t
Name Purpose

bcmSwitchEventClear

Clears the event.

bcmSwitchEventRead

Reads the event.

bcmSwitchEventForce

Activate/diactivate forcing the event.

bcmSwitchEventStormTimedCount

If more than bcmSwitchEventStormTimedCount interrupts occur in bcmSwitchEventStormTimedPeriod period, an interrupt storm is indicated (default handling is same as for bcmSwitchEventStormNominal threshold).

bcmSwitchEventStormTimedPeriod

If more than bcmSwitchEventStormTimedCount interrupts occur in bcmSwitchEventStormTimedPeriod period, an interrupt storm is indicated (default handling same as for bcmSwitchEventStormNominal threshold).

bcmSwitchEventStormNominal

Nominal threshold for interrupt storm detection. If an interrupt occurs more times than the threshold, an interrupt storm is indicated. The default handling for such an interrupt is holding it in masked condition.

bcmSwitchEventPriority

Change handling priority in case of multiple interrupts.

bcmSwitchEventLog

Activate/Diactivate log prints on event.

bcmSwitchEventStat

Enable to Clear/Read event statistics.

bcmSwitchEventCorrActOverride

Enable to override application callback.

bcmSwitchEventUnmaskAndClearDisable

Skip clearing and enabling the asserted interrupt at the end of event corrective action.

bcmSwitchEventForceUnmask

Skip enabling interrupt action for asserted interrupt at the end of event corrective action, if the interrupt is not cleared.

Parameters
[in,out]valueThe configured value for the specified control, e.g. '1' for mask enabled , '0' for mask disabled.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_event_register()

int bcm_switch_event_register ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_event_cb_t  cb,
void *  userdata 
)

Registers/Unregisters a callback function for switch critical events.

These APIs allow to the application to register a callback function which will be called when critical event occurs on the switch. Applications which register for switch events will be notified about critical errors described in table below. The application call back function should log all the information provided in arg1, arg2 and arg3 in such a way that the system operator is made aware of the issue. The system operator may need to take additional actions, up to and include rebooting the swit ch. Call back function is defined as following

typedef void (*bcm_switch_event_cb_t)(
int unit,
bcm_switch_event_t event,
uint32 arg1,
uint32 arg2,
uint32 arg3,
void *userdata);

The callback function can be registered for the following events shown in switch_events

Switch Critical Events
Event Description arg1 arg2 arg3
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_IO_ERROR External Bus access error N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_PARITY_ERROR Parity or ECC error during internal memory access Parity error type. Memory/register ID the parity error is observed. Memory/Register index
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_THREAD_ERROR Critical error during thread execution that caused thread to stop Thread ID. Line number in the SDK source. Failure return code See error_codes
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ACCESS_ERROR Internal Bus access error N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ASSERT_ERROR Assertion condition in a code base was reached N/A line number in the SDK source. N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MODID_CHANGE The MODID was changed N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_DOS_ATTACK DOS attack was detected N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_STABLE_FULL Warm Boot persistent storage full condition N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_STABLE_ERROR Warm Boot data in persistent storage is either corrupt or stale Stable error type Stable flags N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_UNCONTROLLED_SHUTDOWN Warm Boot reinitialization was preceded by a crash N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_WARM_BOOT_DOWNGRADE Downgrade was detected during Warm Boot. See Downgrade Support for more information. BCM Module Identifier. See BCM_MODULES_table Recovered warmboot scache version for the module. Default scache version for the module.
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_DEVICE_INTERRUPT Device interrupt arose Interrupt ID Block number N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM Alarm was generated from switch chips Alarm ID. See switch_alarms See switch_alarms_args See switch_alarms_args
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MMU_BST_TRIGGER MMU resource goes over the programmed resource threshold BST COSQ flags from BCM_BST_COSQ_table COSQ gport/logical port BST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table COSQ BST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_EPON_ALARM Alarm was generated from EPON chips Alarm ID. See epon_alarms Port index Event raise (0) or clear (1)
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_RUNT_DETECT Alarm was generated from HX4 chips Port index N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_AUTONEG_SPEED_ERROR The auto negotiated speed is not supported. Port index The auto negotiated speed Failure return code See error_codes
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MMU_EBST_FIFO_FULL EBST hardware FIFO full hit. buffer id EBST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table N/A N/A

Switch chips can generate the following alarms which are defined in SoC layer

Switch Alarms
Event Description
SOC_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM_HIGH_TEMP Interrupt event triggered due to temperature is exceeding the threshold value of PVTMON used for SW overheating protection method
SOC_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM_125C_TEMP Event of HW logic putting the chip into reset state due to chip overheating

The customer must provide a callback (bcm_switch_event_cb_t) to report detailed alarm information. The parameters in this callback are defined in the following table:

Switch Alarms Args
arg1 arg2 arg2
SOC_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM_HIGH_TEMP PVTMON ID PVTMON Temperature
SOC_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM_125C_TEMP N/A N/A

EPON chips can generate the following alarms which are defined in SoC layer

EPON Alarms
Event Description
SOC_EA_EVENT_EQUIPMENT_ALARM EPON device level alarm, for example: device reset failure
SOC_EA_EVENT_POWER_ALARM Power alarm, for example: no power or abnormal voltage
SOC_EA_EVENT_BATTERY_MISSING_ALARM Battery is provisioned but missing
SOC_EA_EVENT_BATTERY_FAILURE_ALARM Battery is provisioned and present but could not be recharged
SOC_EA_EVENT_BATTERY_VOLT_LOW_ALARM Battery is provisioned and present but its voltage is low
SOC_EA_EVENT_INTRUSION_ALARM Intrusion alarm, for example: box open
SOC_EA_EVENT_TEST_FAILURE_ALARM Fail to do self test
SOC_EA_EVENT_ONU_TEMP_HIGH_ALARM Temperature inside EPON device exceeds the high level
SOC_EA_EVENT_ONU_TEMP_LOW_ALARM Temperature inside EPON device is below the low level
SOC_EA_EVENT_IF_SWITCH_ALARM PON interface switchover
SOC_EA_EVENT_RX_POWER_HIGH_ALARM When RX Power exceeds high alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_RX_POWER_LOW_ALARM When RX Power is below low alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_POWER_HIGH_ALARM When TX Power exceeds high alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_POWER_LOW_ALARM When TX Power is below low alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_BIAS_HIGH_ALARM When TX Bias current exceeds high alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_BIAS_LOW_ALARM When TX Bias current is below low alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_VCC_HIGH_ALARM When internal supply voltage exceeds high alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_VCC_LOW_ALARM When internal supply voltage is below low alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TEMP_HIGH_ALARM When internal temperature exceeds high alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TEMP_LOW_ALARM When internal temperature is below low alarm level
SOC_EA_EVENT_RX_POWER_HIGH_WARNING When Received Power exceeds high warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_RX_POWER_LOW_WARNING When Received Power is below low warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_POWER_HIGH_WARNING When TX output power exceeds high warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_POWER_LOW_WARNING When TX output power is below low warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_BIAS_HIGH_WARNING When TX Bias current exceeds high warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TX_BIAS_LOW_WARNING When TX Bias current is below low warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_VCC_HIGH_WARNING When internal supply voltage exceeds high warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_VCC_LOW_WARNING When internal supply voltage is below low warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TEMP_HIGH_WARNING When internal temperature exceeds high warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_TEMP_LOW_WARNING When internal temperature is below low warning level
SOC_EA_EVENT_AUTONEG_FAILURE_ALARM Failure of auto negotiation for specific Ethernet port
SOC_EA_EVENT_LOS_ALARM Loss of signal for specific Ethernet port or PON port
SOC_EA_EVENT_PORT_FAILURE_ALARM Failure of specific Ethernet port
SOC_EA_EVENT_PORT_LOOPBACK_ALARM Loopback of Ethernet port is detected
SOC_EA_EVENT_PORT_CONGESTION_ALARM Congestion of Ethernet port is detected
SOC_EA_EVENT_OAM_TIMEOUT_ALARM OAM keepalive timeout
SOC_EA_EVENT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILURE_ALARM Security key exchange failure
SOC_EA_EVENT_GPIO_LINK_FAULT_ALARM Link fault alarm has been triggered through GPIO
SOC_EA_EVENT_LOOPBACK_TEST_ENABLE_ALARM The port is in the loopback test (MAC or PHY) state
SOC_EA_EVENT_GPIO_CRICTICAL_EVENT_ALARM Critical event alarm has been triggered through GPIO
SOC_EA_EVENT_GPIO_EXTERNAL_ALARM User-configured external event notification alarm has been triggered through GPIO
SOC_EA_EVENT_AUTH_FAILURE_ALARM ONU authentication failure
SOC_EA_EVENT_STATS_ALARM A statistics counter has reached the programmed alarm value
SOC_EA_EVENT_FLASH_BUSY_ALARM EPON chip is currently erasing the NVS and can not accept new OAM messages
SOC_EA_EVENT_ONU_READY_ALARM EPON chip has completed firmware initialization
SOC_EA_EVENT_PON_DISABLE_ALARM EPON port is in disable state
SOC_EA_EVENT_CTC_DISCOVERY_SUCCESS_ALARM CTC OAM discovery finish
SOC_EVENT_LAYSER_ALWAYS_ON_ALARM EPON optical transceiver laser always on

The customer must provide a callback (bcm_switch_event_cb_t) to report detailed alarm information. The parameters in this callback are defined in the following table:

Parameters in Callback
Parameter Description
unit Switch unit
event Event type, see table switch_events
arg1 Alarm ID, see table epon_alarms
arg2 Port index
arg3 Event raise (0) or clear (1)
userdata Extra information
  • stat_id, for stats alarm (SOC_EA_EVENT_STATS_ALARM), see bcm_stat_val_t
  • alarm_value, alarm value if it exists when raising or clearing an alarm
  • time_stamp, time for alarm report or clear
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]cbA callback function to be called upon critical event
[in,out]userdataPointer to any provided user data to be called with a callback

◆ bcm_switch_event_unregister()

int bcm_switch_event_unregister ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_event_cb_t  cb,
void *  userdata 
)

Registers/Unregisters a callback function for switch critical events.

These APIs allow to the application to register a callback function which will be called when critical event occurs on the switch. Applications which register for switch events will be notified about critical errors described in table below. The application call back function should log all the information provided in arg1, arg2 and arg3 in such a way that the system operator is made aware of the issue. The system operator may need to take additional actions, up to and include rebooting the swit ch. Call back function is defined as following

typedef void (*bcm_switch_event_cb_t)(
int unit,
bcm_switch_event_t event,
uint32 arg1,
uint32 arg2,
uint32 arg3,
void *userdata);

The callback function can be registered for the following events shown in switch_events

Switch Critical Events
Event Description arg1 arg2 arg3
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_IO_ERROR External Bus access error N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_PARITY_ERROR Parity or ECC error during internal memory access Parity error type. Memory/register ID the parity error is observed. Memory/Register index
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_THREAD_ERROR Critical error during thread execution that caused thread to stop Thread ID. Line number in the SDK source. Failure return code See error_codes
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ACCESS_ERROR Internal Bus access error N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ASSERT_ERROR Assertion condition in a code base was reached N/A line number in the SDK source. N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MODID_CHANGE The MODID was changed N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_DOS_ATTACK DOS attack was detected N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_STABLE_FULL Warm Boot persistent storage full condition N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_STABLE_ERROR Warm Boot data in persistent storage is either corrupt or stale Stable error type Stable flags N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_UNCONTROLLED_SHUTDOWN Warm Boot reinitialization was preceded by a crash N/A N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_WARM_BOOT_DOWNGRADE Downgrade was detected during Warm Boot. See Downgrade Support for more information. BCM Module Identifier. See BCM_MODULES_table Recovered warmboot scache version for the module. Default scache version for the module.
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_DEVICE_INTERRUPT Device interrupt arose Interrupt ID Block number N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_ALARM Alarm was generated from switch chips Alarm ID. See switch_alarms See switch_alarms_args See switch_alarms_args
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MMU_BST_TRIGGER MMU resource goes over the programmed resource threshold BST COSQ flags from BCM_BST_COSQ_table COSQ gport/logical port BST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table COSQ BST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table

BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_RUNT_DETECT Alarm was generated from HX4 chips Port index N/A N/A
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_AUTONEG_SPEED_ERROR The auto negotiated speed is not supported. Port index The auto negotiated speed Failure return code See error_codes
BCM_SWITCH_EVENT_MMU_EBST_FIFO_FULL EBST hardware FIFO full hit. buffer id EBST_EVENT_CB_ARG_table N/A N/A

Parameters in Callback
Parameter Description
unit Switch unit
event Event type, see table switch_events
arg1 Alarm ID, see table epon_alarms
arg2 Port index
arg3 Event raise (0) or clear (1)
userdata Extra information
  • stat_id, for stats alarm (SOC_EA_EVENT_STATS_ALARM), see bcm_stat_val_t
  • alarm_value, alarm value if it exists when raising or clearing an alarm
  • time_stamp, time for alarm report or clear

[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]cbA callback function to be called upon critical event
[in,out]userdataPointer to any provided user data to be called with a callback

uint32 flags,
void *userdata);

[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]flags

bcm_switch_hard_reset_callback_t  callback,
void *  userdata 
)

Registers/Unregisters a callback function for switch critical events - hard reset.

typedef void (*bcm_switch_hard_reset_callback_t)(
int unit,

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_t *  bank_control 
)

Hash bank control set/get function.

These APIs allow to update/retrieve configuration settings for given bank, such as updating hash offset and enabling/disabling robust hash. The member 'valid_fields' in the bank control structure indicates the desired configuration(s) for setting or retrieving. The valid_fields can be a combination of the bank control flags defined in BCM_SWITCH_HASH_BANK_CONTROL_XXX. This allows user application to set/get multiple bank configurations in a single call.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]bank_control(IN/OUT) Pointer to a hash bank control structure.

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_init()

void bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_init ( bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_t *  bank_control)

Initialize a hash bank control structure.

Initialize a hash bank control structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_t structure, and bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]bank_control(IN/OUT) Pointer to a hash bank control structure.

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_set()

int bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_set ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_bank_control_t *  bank_control 
)

Hash bank control set/get function.

These APIs allow to update/retrieve configuration settings for given bank, such as updating hash offset and enabling/disabling robust hash. The member 'valid_fields' in the bank control structure indicates the desired configuration(s) for setting or retrieving. The valid_fields can be a combination of the bank control flags defined in BCM_SWITCH_HASH_BANK_CONTROL_XXX. This allows user application to set/get multiple bank configurations in a single call.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]bank_control(IN/OUT) Pointer to a hash bank control structure.

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_t *  bank_info 
)

Get information about a hash bank.

This API allows to retrieve hardware parameters about a hash hank, such as the width of base entry and the number of base entries. The caller must specify a bank number in the parameter 'bank_num'.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]bank_info(IN/OUT) Pointer to a hash bank information structure.

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_init()

void bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_init ( bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_t *  bank_info)

Initialize a hash bank information structure.

Initialize a hash bank information structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_t structure, and bcm_switch_hash_bank_info_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]bank_info(IN/OUT) Pointer to a hash bank information structure.

◆ bcm_switch_hash_bank_multi_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_bank_multi_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_table_t  hash_table,
int  array_size,
bcm_switch_hash_bank_t *  bank_array,
int *  num_banks 
)

Get the hash banks assigned to a hash table.

This API allow to retrieve a set of hash banks assigned to a given hash table. The caller must pre-allocate a buffer array to hold the returned hash banks. Some hash banks are shared among multiple hash tables. There is a chance that the same set of hash banks are returned for different hash tables.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]hash_tableHash table.
[in,out]array_sizeArray size of bank_array.
[in,out]bank_arrayHash bank array.
[in,out]num_banksActual number of hash banks returned in bank_array.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_hash_banks_config_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_banks_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_table_t  hash_table,
uint32  bank_num,
int *  hash_type,
uint32 *  hash_offset 
)

Set/Get hash type for a multi bank hash table.

These APIs allow to set/get the hash type per bank for multi bank hash tables. The number of banks used by a hash table are obtained using bcm_switch_hash_banks_max_get The following hash types are supported:

Hash types
Hash type Description
BCM_HASH_ZERO Always return 0 (debug only)
BCM_HASH_LSB return LSB of key
BCM_HASH_CRC16L Lower bits of CRC-16
BCM_HASH_CRC16U Upper bits of CRC-16
BCM_HASH_CRC32L Lower bits of CRC-32
BCM_HASH_CRC32U Upper bits of CRC-32
BCM_HASH_OFFSET Use supplied offset value into the hash value
Parameters
[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]hash_tableHash table type see multi_hash_table
[in,out]bank_numBank number for the table
[in,out]hash_type(IN/OUT) Hash type to configure for the bank
[in,out]hash_offset(IN/OUT) Hash offset value when hash_type is BCM_HASH_OFFSET

◆ bcm_switch_hash_banks_config_set()

int bcm_switch_hash_banks_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_table_t  hash_table,
uint32  bank_num,
int  hash_type,
uint32  hash_offset 
)

Set/Get hash type for a multi bank hash table.

These APIs allow to set/get the hash type per bank for multi bank hash tables. The number of banks used by a hash table are obtained using bcm_switch_hash_banks_max_get The following hash types are supported:

Hash types
Hash type Description
BCM_HASH_ZERO Always return 0 (debug only)
BCM_HASH_LSB return LSB of key
BCM_HASH_CRC16L Lower bits of CRC-16
BCM_HASH_CRC16U Upper bits of CRC-16
BCM_HASH_CRC32L Lower bits of CRC-32
BCM_HASH_CRC32U Upper bits of CRC-32
BCM_HASH_OFFSET Use supplied offset value into the hash value
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]hash_tableHash table type see multi_hash_table
[in,out]bank_numBank number for the table
[in,out]hash_type(IN/OUT) Hash type to configure for the bank
[in,out]hash_offset(IN/OUT) Hash offset value when hash_type is BCM_HASH_OFFSET

◆ bcm_switch_hash_banks_max_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_banks_max_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_table_t  hash_table,
uint32 *  bank_count 
)

Get number of banks for a hash table.

This API is used to get the number of hash banks used by a multi bank Hash table for further configuring the per bank hash type. This does not support the legacy dual hash tables. The following hash tables are supported

Multi bank hash tables
Table Description
bcmHashTableL2 L2 hash table
bcmHashTableL3 L3 hash table
bcmHashTableVlanTranslate VLAN Translate hash table
bcmHashTableEgressVlanTranslate Egress VLAN Translate hash table
bcmHashTableMPLS MPLS hash table
bcmHashTableFlowtrackerEntry Flowtracker Entry hash table
bcmHashTableL2Tunnel L2 tunnel termination hash table
bcmHashTableL2TunnelVnid L2 tunnel Vnid hash table
bcmHashTableL3Tunnel L3 tunnel termination hash table
bcmHashTableExactMatch FP exact match hash table
bcmHashTableIpmcGroup L3 IPv4/IPv6 multicast (*,G) hash table
bcmHashTableIpmcSourceGroup L3 IPv4/IPv6 multicast (S,G) hash table
bcmHashTableL2mc L2 IPv4/IPv6 multicast hash table
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]hash_tableHash table type
[in,out]bank_countNumber of banks used by this table

◆ bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t_init()

void bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t_init ( bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t *  config)

Initialize a bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t structure.

Initializes a flex hashing configuration parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t structure, and bcm_switch_hash_entry_config_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]config(IN/OUT) flex hashing configuration parameters
Return values
NOTHING

◆ bcm_switch_hash_entry_create_qset()

bcm_hash_entry_t *  entry 
)

Create a blank flex hash entry.

This API, unlike xref=bcm_switch_hash_entry_create , takes a bcm_field_qset_t INPUT instead of a bcm_field_group_t INPUT. The qset should be filled with the UDF APIs defined in UDF Resources Management

[in,out]qset<UNDEF>
[in,out]entry<UNDEF>

◆ bcm_switch_hash_entry_install()

int bcm_switch_hash_entry_install ( int  unit,
bcm_hash_entry_t  entry,
uint32  offset 
)

Installs a flex hash entry into the hardware tables.

This API installs a flex hash entry into the hardware tables. If using SWITCH_HASH_USE_CONFIG as a input of offset, it indicate offset and mask of HW could be configured by bcm_switch_hash_entry_set() API.

Parameters
[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]entryBCM hash entry
[in,out]offsetBCM hash offset

◆ bcm_switch_hash_table_multi_get()

int bcm_switch_hash_table_multi_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_hash_bank_t  bank_num,
int  array_size,
bcm_switch_hash_table_t *  table_array,
int *  num_tables 
)

Get a set of hash tables to which the given hash bank is assigned.

This API allow to retrieve a set of hash tables to which a given hash bank is assigned. The caller must pre-allocate a buffer array to hold the returned hash tables. If more than one hash tables are returned. It indicates the given hash bank is shared among these hash tables.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]bank_numBank number.
[in,out]array_sizeArray size of table_array.
[in,out]table_arrayHash table array.
[in,out]num_tablesActual number of hash tables returned in table_array.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_ipv6_reserved_multicast_addr_get()

)

int bcm_switch_ipv6_reserved_multicast_addr_multi_get ( int  unit,
int  inner,
int  num,
bcm_ip6_t *  ip6_addr,

◆ bcm_switch_ipv6_reserved_multicast_addr_set()

int bcm_switch_ipv6_reserved_multicast_addr_set ( int  unit,
bcm_ip6_t  ip6_addr,
bcm_ip6_t  ip6_mask 
)

Sets Ipv6 reserved multicast address and mask of the device.

This API sets the reserved multicast address for the device i.e. the ip6 address passed to this API will be treated as reserved IPV6 multicast address for the device. The api is flexible to accept any mask and address.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]ip6_addripv6 address
[in,out]ip6_maskipv6 mask
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_issu_upgrade_done()

int bcm_switch_issu_upgrade_done ( )

ISSU upgrade done.

This function releases all the resources that were used by the ISSU. In particular it unloads the ISSU DLL. It is assume that this function is being called once all the units had completed their upgrade.

Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_issu_upgrade_start()

int bcm_switch_issu_upgrade_start ( const char *  from_ver,
const char *  to_ver 
)

ISSU upgrade start.

This function initiates the ISSU process. It starts by loading the ISSU DLL. It laters informs the system manager engine about the ongoing update by assigning values to callback functions being executed during the pre config stage.

Parameters
[in,out]from_verThe previous version of software that was running.
[in,out]to_verThe version of the current software.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

)

◆ bcm_switch_l3_protocol_group_get()

int bcm_switch_l3_protocol_group_get ( int  unit,
uint32 *  group_members,
bcm_l3_protocol_group_id_t *  group_id 
)

Assign/get protocol groups for multiple mymac termination.

When using multiple mymac termination feature, L3 protocols can be divided into different groups. The group is part of the key used to decide whether the packet will be l2 terminated. Use this api to assign the different l3 protocols into groups. The default group for all protocols is 0, and protocls in re-set groups that weren't reassigned would be automatically reassigned to group 0. For the get api, the input can be either the group members, and the group number will be returned, or the input can be the group number, and all members assigned to it will be returned. Either way, the other one must be -1 (MAX_UINT32 for flags and MAX_UINT8 for group_id). The protocol are given in the form of flags. The flags are:

BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_* flags
Name Description Value
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_NONE No protocols in this group. 0x0000
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_IPV4 Add IPv4 to the group. 0x0001
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_IPV6 Add IPv6 to the group. 0x0002
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_ARP Add ARP to the group. 0x0004
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_MPLS Add MPLS to the group. 0x0008
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_MIM Add MiM to the group. 0x0010
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_TRILL Add trill to the group. 0x0020
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_FCOE Add FCOE to the group. 0x0040
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]group_members(for set) The protocols to be assigned to the group.
(INOUT) (for get) The protocols assigned to the group.
[in,out]group_id(for set) The group to which the l3 protocols are to be assigned.
(INOUT) (for get) The group to which the l3 protocols are assigned.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_l3_protocol_group_set()

int bcm_switch_l3_protocol_group_set ( int  unit,
uint32  group_members,
bcm_l3_protocol_group_id_t  group_id 
)

Assign/get protocol groups for multiple mymac termination.

When using multiple mymac termination feature, L3 protocols can be divided into different groups. The group is part of the key used to decide whether the packet will be l2 terminated. Use this api to assign the different l3 protocols into groups. The default group for all protocols is 0, and protocls in re-set groups that weren't reassigned would be automatically reassigned to group 0. For the get api, the input can be either the group members, and the group number will be returned, or the input can be the group number, and all members assigned to it will be returned. Either way, the other one must be -1 (MAX_UINT32 for flags and MAX_UINT8 for group_id). The protocol are given in the form of flags. The flags are:

BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_* flags
Name Description Value
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_NONE No protocols in this group. 0x0000
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_IPV4 Add IPv4 to the group. 0x0001
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_IPV6 Add IPv6 to the group. 0x0002
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_ARP Add ARP to the group. 0x0004
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_MPLS Add MPLS to the group. 0x0008
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_MIM Add MiM to the group. 0x0010
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_TRILL Add trill to the group. 0x0020
BCM_SWITCH_L3_PROTOCOL_GROUP_FCOE Add FCOE to the group. 0x0040
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]group_members(for set) The protocols to be assigned to the group.
(INOUT) (for get) The protocols assigned to the group.
[in,out]group_id(for set) The group to which the l3 protocols are to be assigned.
(INOUT) (for get) The group to which the l3 protocols are assigned.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_match_config_add()

int bcm_switch_match_config_add ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_match_service_t  match_service,
bcm_switch_match_config_info_t *  config_info,
int *  match_id 
)

Add a match config.

This API is used to create a match object, match_id will be returned after the match object created successfully. The match_id will be used by the other entry operations.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]match_serviceMatch service type.
[in,out]config_infoMatch configuration.
[in,out]match_idMatch ID.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_match_config_delete()

◆ bcm_switch_match_config_info_t_init()

void bcm_switch_match_config_info_t_init ( bcm_switch_match_config_info_t *  config_info)

Initialize a bcm_switch_match_config_info_t structure.

Initialize an match info parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_match_config_info_t structure, and bcm_switch_match_config_info_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]config_info(IN/OUT) match config info parameters.
Return values
VOID

◆ bcm_switch_network_group_config_get()

int bcm_switch_network_group_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_network_group_t  source_network_group_id,
bcm_switch_network_group_config_t *  config 
)

Gets the split horizon network group configuration for a given pair of source and destination network group.

The following config_flags are available

Split horizon network group config flags
Flag Description
BCM_SWITCH_NETWORK_GROUP_MCAST_GROUP_REMAP Enable/DIsable IPMC group remap
BCM_SWITCH_NETWORK_GROUP_INGRESS_PRUNE_ENABLE Enable/DIsable ingress pruning
BCM_SWITCH_NETWORK_GROUP_EGRESS_PRUNE_ENABLE Enable/DIsable egress pruning
Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]source_network_group_idsource split horizon network group id.
[in,out]configsplit horizon network group configuration.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_network_group_config_set()

int bcm_switch_network_group_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_network_group_t  source_network_group_id,
bcm_switch_network_group_config_t *  config 
)

Configures the split horizon network group configuration for a given pair of source and destination network group.

This API is used for enabling/disabling split horizon network group configurations like ingress pruning, egress pruning and ingress IPMC group remap for a given pair of source and destination split horizon network group. BCM5645x family of devices support 8 split horizon group. Split horizon group id 0 is reserved.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]source_network_group_idsource split horizon network group id.
[in,out]configsplit horizon network group configuration.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_network_group_config_t_init()

Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_object_count_get()

int bcm_switch_object_count_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_object_t  object,
int *  entries 
)

Retrieving the statistics on the number of API objects.

This API is used to retrieve the count of objects currently created in the system. To retrieve total number of L3 routes in system, bcmSwitchObjectL3RouteTotalUsedRoutes should be used. bcmSwitchObjectL3HostCurrent returns the number of occupied L3 indexes. The number of indexes used are different for different type of entries. Below are the indexes used by each type of host entry V4Host -> 1, 64bit-V6Host -> 1, 128bit-V6Host -> 2, V4MC -> 2 , V6MC -> 4.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]objectObject name for which the count is to be retrieved
[in,out]entriesThe number of entries in the system
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_object_count_multi_get()

int bcm_switch_object_count_multi_get ( int  unit,
int  object_size,
bcm_switch_object_t *  object_array,
int *  entries 
)

Retrieving the statistics on the number of API objects. This retrieves for multiple objects.

This function is similar to bcm_switch_object_count_get except for retrieving the count for multiple objects

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]object_sizeNumber of objects for which the entries are to be retrieved
[in,out]object_arrayObject names for which the count is to be retrieved
[in,out]entriesThe number of entries in the system for each object in array
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add()

int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *  l2_addr 
)

Set/Replace MAC address assigned to Offload Processor connecting port.

This API configures MAC address which is used by BCM device as destination MAC address of L2 header sent towards OLP from BCM device. Optional flag BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE can be used under options parameter of this API to replace the existing entry.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsOperational control options : BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE.
[in,out]l2_addrOLP MAC address information, indexed by port.
Optional Flags for bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add
Name Description
BCM_SWITCH_OLP_L2_ADDR_REPLACE Replace the matching entry
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_delete()

◆ bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t_init()

void bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t_init ( bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t *  l2_addr)

Initialize a bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t structure.

Initializes a OLP L2 information structure to default values. Whereas bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t is defined as:

typedef struct bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_s {
bcm_port_t port; // BCM device connecting port for this entry.
bcm_mac_t mac; // MAC address for this entry
} bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_t;
Parameters:
port BCM device port number.
mac 6 bytes MAC address assigned to OLP interfacing port.
Parameters
[in,out]l2_addr(IN/OUT) OLP MAC address information, indexed by port.
Return values
NOTHING

◆ bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse()

int bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_traverse ( int  unit,

void *  user_data 
)

Traverse previously configured OLP MAC addresses and call callback function for each valid OLP MAC.

This API traverse all previously configured OLP MAC address by API bcm_switch_olp_l2_addr_add() and envoke callback function for each valid OLP MAC entry. Whereas Callback function syntax is:

l2_addr OLP MAC address info (OUT).
user_data User data to be passed to callback function (OUT).

◆ bcm_switch_opaque_tag_config_get()

)

Read opaque tag parameters configured for a given set.

This API reads the values of opaque tag parameters programmed in the hardware registers for the set specified by argument 'index'.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t_init()

void bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t_init ( bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t *  action)

An API to initialize a packet control action structure.

Initialize a packet control action structure. The bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t structure is defined as:

// Packet control action structure, common for integrity check API and protocol control API.
typedef struct bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_s {
uint8 discard; // Packet is discarded.
uint8 copy_to_cpu; // Packet is copied to CPU.
uint8 flood; // Packet is flooded to the forwarding domain.
uint8 bpdu; // Packet is BPDU.
uint8 learn_disable; // L2 learning is disabled.
} bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t;
Parameters
[in,out]action(IN/OUT) Pointer to a packet control action structure.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_info_hash_get()

int bcm_switch_pkt_info_hash_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_pkt_info_t *  pkt_info,
bcm_gport_t *  dst_gport,
bcm_if_t *  dst_intf 
)

Gets the hash result for the specified link aggregation method using provided packet parameters and device configuration.

This API will use provided packet information elements in conjunction with the current device configuration to determine either the destination system port for a LAG-directed packet or the egress object for a packet undergoing ECMP routing. Note that only unicast L2 or L3 single-tagged packets without tunnel encapsulation are supported. Always initialize a switch packet information structure using the bcm_switch_pkt_info_t_init function prior to passing it to an API, because future API releases may add more structure members. For Tomahawk, Internal device packet tracing (Visibility) feature with bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_get API provides detailed hashing resolution information instead of bcm_switch_pkt_info_hash_get API.

typedef struct bcm_switch_pkt_info_s {
uint32 flags; // BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_xxx flags for packet parameter hashing.
bcm_gport_t src_gport; // Source module and port, BCM_GPORT_INVALID to wildcard.
bcm_vlan_t vid; // VLAN ID.
bcm_ethertype_t ethertype; // EtherType
bcm_mac_t src_mac; // Source MAC address.
bcm_mac_t dst_mac; // Destination MAC address.
bcm_ip_t sip; // Source host IP address (IPv4).
bcm_ip_t dip; // Destination host IP address (IPv4).
bcm_ip6_t sip6; // Source host IP address (IPv6).
bcm_ip6_t dip6; // Destination host IP address (IPv6).
uint8 protocol; // IP protocol
uint32 src_l4_port; // Source L4 port
uint32 dst_l4_port; // Destination L4 port.
bcm_gport_t trunk_gport; // Gport of trunk type on which packet will egress.
bcm_if_t mpintf; // Multipath egress forwarding object.
bcm_switch_pkt_hash_info_fwd_reason_t fwd_reason; // Packet forward reason.
bcm_mpls_label_t top_label; // First label in MPLS stack.
bcm_mpls_label_t second_label; // Second label in MPLS stack.
bcm_mpls_label_t third_label; // Third label in MPLS stack.
} bcm_switch_pkt_info_t;
typedef enum bcm_switch_pkt_hash_info_fwd_reason_e {
bcmSwitchPktHashInfoFwdReasonUnicast = 0, // Known unicast packet
bcmSwitchPktHashInfoFwdReasonIpmc = 1, // L3 multicast packet
bcmSwitchPktHashInfoFwdReasonL2mc = 2, // L2 multicast packet
bcmSwitchPktHashInfoFwdReasonBcast = 3, // Broadcast packet
bcmSwitchPktHashInfoFwdReasonDlf = 4 // Destination lookup failed packet
} bcm_switch_pkt_hash_info_fwd_reason_t;

The flags field in the Switch packet information structure is a logical OR of one or more of the following flags.

BCM Switch packet information flags
Name Purpose

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_SRC_GPORT

Source gport (module, port) field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_VLAN

VLAN identifier field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_ETHERTYPE

EtherType field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_SRC_MAC

Source MAC address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_DST_MAC

Destination MAC address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_SRC_IP

Source IPv4 address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_DST_IP

Destination IPv4 address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_SRC_IPV6

Source IPv6 address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_DST_IPV6

Destination IPv6 address field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_PROTOCOL

IP protocol field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_SRC_L4_PORT

Source L4 port field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_DST_L4_PORT

Destination L4 port field valid.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_TRUNK

Retrieve trunk hash result.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_MULTIPATH

Retrieve ECMP hash result.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_UDP_SOURCE_PORT

Retrieve 16bit Entropy Value of VxLan packet.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_LBID

Retrieve LBID.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_OVERLAY

Retrieve ECMP hash result for overlay layer.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_TOP_LABEL

First label in MPLS stack.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_2ND_LABEL

Second label in MPLS stack.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_3RD_LABEL

Third label in MPLS stack.

BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_LABELS_4MSB

4MSB of top, second and third label in MPLS stack.

Use BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_* flags to indicate the valid packet information fields in the bcm_switch_pkt_info_t structure. If the BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_MULTIPATH flag is set, an L3 interface ID egress object will be returned in the dst_intf pointer on success. If the BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_MULTIPATH is not set but BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_HASH_TRUNK flag is set, the destination system port is returned in the dst_gport pointer. If the device configuration requires more packet information than is supplied in the bcm_switch_pkt_info_t structure as indicated by the BCM_SWITCH_PKT_INFO_* flags, a BCM_E_PARAM error is returned.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]pkt_infoPacket parameter information for hash calculation.
[in,out]dst_gportDestination module and port.
[in,out]dst_intfDestination L3 interface ID egress object.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_info_t_init()

void bcm_switch_pkt_info_t_init ( bcm_switch_pkt_info_t *  pkt_info)

Initialize a bcm_switch_pkt_info_t structure.

Initializes a packet hashing parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_pkt_info_t structure, and bcm_switch_pkt_info_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]pkt_info(IN/OUT) Packet hashing parameters
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_add()

int bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_add ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t *  match,
bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t *  action,
int  priority 
)

Add an entry into packet integrity check table.

This API is used mainly for dos attack checks and the other packet header validation checks. It allows customers to identify malformed or suspect packets and then perform actions, such as drop and/or copy the packet to the CPU, etc. The option flag BCM_SWITCH_PKT_CONTROL_OPTIONS_REPLACE is to update existing entry with new action and/or priority. Parameter 'match' is to specify the match attributes for integrity check, like destination IP address is all zeros, destination MAC address equals source MAC address, etc. The priority of entry is represented by a non-negative number, higher number has a higher priority. If multiple entries with same priority are matched, the entry inserted earlier will take effect.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsOptions flags
[in,out]matchPointer to a packet integrity match attribute structure.
[in,out]actionPointer to a packet control action structure.
[in,out]priorityEntry priority.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_delete()

int bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_delete ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t *  match 
)

Delete an entry from packet integrity check table.

Delete the packet integrity check entry. The caller must specify a match attributes in the parameter 'match'.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]matchPointer to a packet integrity match attribute structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_get()

int bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_check_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t *  match,
bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t *  action,
int *  priority 
)

Get an entry from packet integrity check table.

Get actions and entry priority for a packet integrity check entry. The caller must specify a match attributes in the parameter 'match'. The associated actions and priority will be returned.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]matchPointer to a packet integrity match attribute structure.
[in,out]actionPointer to a packet control action structure.
[in,out]priorityEntry priority.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t_init()

void bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t_init ( bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t *  match)

Initialize a packet integrity match attribute structure.

Initialize a packet integrity match attribute structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t structure, and bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values. The bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t structure is defined as:

// Packet integrity match attribute structure.
typedef struct bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_s {
uint8 tunnel_processing_results_1; // Tunnel processing results 1.
uint8 tunnel_processing_results_1_mask; // Tunnel processing results 1 mask.
uint8 mpls_flow_type; // Mpls flow type.
uint8 mpls_flow_type_mask; // Mpls flow type mask.
uint8 my_station_1_hit; // My station 1 hit.
uint8 my_station_1_hit_mask; // My station 1 hit mask.
uint8 l4_valid; // L4 valid.
uint8 l4_valid_mask; // L4 valid mask.
uint8 icmp_type; // Icmp type.
uint8 icmp_type_mask; // Icmp type mask.
uint8 ip_last_protocol; // Ip last protocol.
uint8 ip_last_protocol_mask; // Ip last protocol mask.
uint16 tcp_hdr_len_and_flags; // Tcp hdr len and flags.
uint16 tcp_hdr_len_and_flags_mask; // Tcp hdr len and flags mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_0; // Fixed hve result 0.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_0_mask; // Fixed hve result 0 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_1; // Fixed hve result 1.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_1_mask; // Fixed hve result 1 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_2; // Fixed hve result 2.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_2_mask; // Fixed hve result 2 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_3; // Fixed hve result 3.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_3_mask; // Fixed hve result 3 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_4; // Fixed hve result 4.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_4_mask; // Fixed hve result 4 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_5; // Fixed hve result 5.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_5_mask; // Fixed hve result 5 mask.
uint8 flex_hve_result_0; // Flex hve result 0.
uint8 flex_hve_result_0_mask; // Flex hve result 0 mask.
uint8 flex_hve_result_1; // Flex hve result 1.
uint8 flex_hve_result_1_mask; // Flex hve result 1 mask.
uint8 flex_hve_result_2; // Flex hve result 2.
uint8 flex_hve_result_2_mask; // Flex hve result 2 mask.
} bcm_switch_pkt_integrity_match_t;
Parameters
[in,out]match(IN/OUT) Pointer to a packet integrity match attribute structure.
Return values
NOTHING

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_add()

int bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_add ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t *  match,
bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t *  action,
int  priority 
)

An API to add a protocol control entry.

Add a protocol control entry. The options flags is defined as below. Note that they can be used by both integrity check API and protocol control API.

// Packet control options flags, common for integrity check API and protocol control API.
#define BCM_SWITCH_PKT_CONTROL_OPTIONS_REPLACE 0x00000001 // Replace a packet control entry.

This API is used to insert one protocol control entry which will match all attributes specified in parameter match, like destination MAC address, virtual forwarding instance, protocol type, etc and then perform the actions specified in action, like drop, copy to CPU, forward, bpdu, etc. If user does not care some packet info, they can set corresponding mask to zero to skip matching it. Calling this API with BCM_SWITCH_PKT_CONTROL_OPTIONS_REPLACE option flag is to update the action/priority of specific protocol control entry. As for fields of match structure, please note that: 1.The vfi/vfi_mask is to indicate physical virtual forwarding instance instead of logical VPN value as the mask is bitwise AND with a vfi value. 2.The l4_src_port, l4_dst_port, icmp_type, ip_last_protocol fields are applied to both IPv4 and IPv6 packets simultaneously. For example, if user sets ip_last_protocol to 0x11(UDP), the entry will match both IPv4 and IPv6 packets. 3.Priority is to indicate the priority of entry, which means the entry with bigger priority value will have higher priority to take effect when multiple entries are matched. If multiple entries with same priority are matched, the entry inserted earlier by user will take effect.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsOptions flags
[in,out]matchProtocol match structure.
[in,out]actionPacket control action.
[in,out]priorityEntry priority.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_delete()

int bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_delete ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t *  match 
)

An API to delete a protocol control entry.

Delete a protocol control entry. The API is used to delete the protocol control entry which matches all protocol attributes specified in parameter match.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]matchProtocol match structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_get()

int bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_control_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t *  match,
bcm_switch_pkt_control_action_t *  action,
int *  priority 
)

An API to get action and priority for a protocol control entry.

Get action and priority for a protocol control entry. The API is used to search protocol control entry which matches all protocol attributes specified in parameter match. If found, actions will be returned in action parameter, and priority will be returned in priority parameter.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]matchProtocol match structure.
[in,out]actionPacket control action.
[in,out]priorityEntry priority.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t_init()

void bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t_init ( bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t *  match)

An API to initialize a protocol match structure.

Initialize a bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t structure. The bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t structure is defined as:

// Packet protocol match structure.
typedef struct bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_s {
uint8 l2_iif_opaque_ctrl_id; // L2 iif based control id.
uint8 l2_iif_opaque_ctrl_id_mask; // L2 iif based control id mask.
bcm_vlan_t vfi; // Virtual forwarding instance.
bcm_vlan_t vfi_mask; // VFI mask.
bcm_mac_t macda; // Destination MAC address.
bcm_mac_t macda_mask; // Destination MAC address mask.
uint16 ethertype; // Ethernet type.
uint16 ethertype_mask; // Ethernet type mask.
uint16 arp_rarp_opcode; // ARP/RARP packet operation code.
uint16 arp_rarp_opcode_mask; // ARP/RARP packet operation code mask.
uint8 icmp_type; // ICMP type.
uint8 icmp_type_mask; // ICMP type mask.
uint8 igmp_type; // IGMP type.
uint8 igmp_type_mask; // IGMP type mask.
uint8 l4_valid; // If set, layer 4 header present.
uint8 l4_valid_mask; // L4_valid mask.
uint16 l4_src_port; // Layer 4 source port.
uint16 l4_src_port_mask; // Layer 4 source port mask.
uint16 l4_dst_port; // Layer 4 destination port.
uint16 l4_dst_port_mask; // Layer 4 destination port mask.
uint16 l5_bytes_0_1; // First 2 bytes of layer 5 header.
uint16 l5_bytes_0_1_mask; // L5_bytes_0_1 mask.
uint8 ip_last_protocol; // Protocol from IP extension header if present, otherwise from IP header.
uint8 ip_last_protocol_mask; // Ip_last_protocol mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_set_1; // Fixed HVE result 1.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_set_1_mask; // Fixed HVE result 1 mask.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_set_5; // Fixed HVE result 5.
uint8 fixed_hve_result_set_5_mask; // Fixed HVE result 5 mask.
uint8 flex_hve_result_set_1; // Flex HVE result 1.
uint8 flex_hve_result_set_1_mask; // Flex HVE result 1 mask.
uint8 tunnel_processing_results_1; // Tunnel processing results 1.
uint8 tunnel_processing_results_1_mask; // Tunnel processing results 1 mask.
uint8 vfp_opaque_ctrl_id; // VFP opaque ctrl id.
uint8 vfp_opaque_ctrl_id_mask; // VFP opaque ctrl id mask.
} bcm_switch_pkt_protocol_match_t;
Parameters
[in,out]match(IN/OUT) Pointer to a protocol match structure.

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_clear()

int bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_clear ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port 
)

Clear the visibility SW and HW configuration and states.

The API is used to clear the existing SW states for the visibility capture on the given port. It also clears the HW capture buffers for the pipe on which the port resides. If the port is passed in as -1 then the SW and HW capture states respective to all the pipes are cleared.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]portLocal front panel port through which the visibility packet ingresses.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_get()

int bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_get ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
uint8  port,
int  len,
uint8 *  data,
bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_t *  pkt_trace_info 
)

Generate a visibility trace packet and/or read the result of the packets ingress processing information.

pkt_trace_info_t is not required to be initialized before it is used in bcm_switch_pkt_trace_info_get

BCM Packet Trace Options (supported on release after 6.4.3)
Name Purpose

BCM_PKT_TRACE_NO_IFP

if not set, the visibility packet is subject to IFP rules, meters, counters etc

BCM_PKT_TRACE_FORWARD

If set, honor pipeline forward decision, if not set, Drop at MMU

BCM_PKT_TRACE_LEARN

learn visibility packets source mac address

BCM_PKT_TRACE_DROP_TO_MMU

Drop the visibility packet at MMU.

BCM_PKT_TRACE_DROP_TO_EGRESS

Drop the visibility packet at Egress.

BCM_PKT_TRACE_RETRIEVE_DATA_ONLY

Get the visibility data with no manual packet injected.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsFLAGS to select pre-configured cpu_pkt_profile register values and to provide additional instructions to the SDK
[in,out]port
[in,out]lenNumber of bytes to copy from data
[in,out]dataSource packet buffer to copy from
[in,out]pkt_trace_info
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_pkt_trace_raw_data_get()

int bcm_switch_pkt_trace_raw_data_get ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
uint8  port,
int  len,
uint8 *  data,
uint32  raw_data_buf_size,
uint8 *  raw_data,
uint32 *  raw_data_size 
)

Generate a visibility trace packet and then read the visibility packet debug information as raw data.

Generate a visibility packet. Read visibility packet process data for chip and store the raw data into buffer. Expected raw_data_buffer for param raw_data_buf_size is 8K. These profile options are used to set loopback headers cpu_pkt_profile field For Trident3 For BCM56870_A0 packet trace works when single debug visibility packet is being swicthed in the system.\br \br For BCM5677x family of devices, Packet trace is not expected to work with IP-EP clock gating enabled.\br Please use the config property "ipep_clock_gating_disable=1" before using visibility application.\br All the other conditions that apply for BCM5687x series are applicable for BCM5677x devices as well.\br \br

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsFLAGS to select pre-configured cpu_pkt_profile register values.
[in,out]porta local front panel port the visibility packet is injected.
[in,out]lenNumber of bytes to copy from data.
[in,out]dataSource packet buffer to copy from.
[in,out]raw_data_buf_sizeRaw data buffer size.
[in,out]raw_data(INOUT) Raw data buffer.
[in,out]raw_data_size(INOUT) Raw data size read.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_reflector_create()

int bcm_switch_reflector_create ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_if_t *  encap_id,
bcm_switch_reflector_data_t *  data 
)

Create/Destroy/Get encap ID for L2/L3 relfectors (both unicast and multicast) .

These APIs provides the following reflector functionality:

  • Create reflector encap_ID with the specified data
  • Destroy allocated reflector encap ID
  • Get data of allocated reflector encap ID
  • Traverse allocated reflector encap IDs
    typedef enum bcm_switch_reflector_type_e {
    bcmSwitchReflectorUc = 0, // L2 or L3 unicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorL2McExternal = 1, // L2 external multicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorL2McInternal = 2, // L2 external multicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorTwampIp4 = 4, // TWAMP reflector over IPv4
    bcmSwitchReflectorTwampIp6 = 8 // TWAMP reflector over IPv6
    } bcm_switch_reflector_type_t;
    typedef struct bcm_switch_reflector_data_s {
    bcm_switch_reflector_type_t type; // reflector type
    bcm_mac_t mc_reflector_my_mac; // Source MAC address stamped on the response packet. Relevant for MC reflector only.
    uint32 error_estimate; // ERROR_ESTIMATE
    bcm_if_t next_encap_id; // Next pointer encap id for the RCH Ethernet encapsulation
    } bcm_switch_reflector_data_t;
    typedef void (*bcm_switch_reflector_traverse_cb)(
    int unit,
    bcm_if_t encap_id,
    void *user_data);
Parameters
[in,out]unitBCM device number
[in,out]flagssee BCM_SWITCH_REFLECTOR_X
[in,out]encap_idthe allocated destroyed encap ID
[in,out]datadata used for the allocated encap ID

◆ bcm_switch_reflector_data_t_init()

void bcm_switch_reflector_data_t_init ( bcm_switch_reflector_data_t *  data)

data bcm_switch_reflector_data_t initialization

Parameters
[in,out]datadata to initialize

◆ bcm_switch_reflector_traverse()

int bcm_switch_reflector_traverse ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_switch_reflector_traverse_cb  traverse_cb,
void *  user_data 
)

Create/Destroy/Get encap ID for L2/L3 relfectors (both unicast and multicast) .

These APIs provides the following reflector functionality:

  • Create reflector encap_ID with the specified data
  • Destroy allocated reflector encap ID
  • Get data of allocated reflector encap ID
  • Traverse allocated reflector encap IDs
    typedef enum bcm_switch_reflector_type_e {
    bcmSwitchReflectorUc = 0, // L2 or L3 unicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorL2McExternal = 1, // L2 external multicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorL2McInternal = 2, // L2 external multicast reflector
    bcmSwitchReflectorTwampIp4 = 4, // TWAMP reflector over IPv4
    bcmSwitchReflectorTwampIp6 = 8 // TWAMP reflector over IPv6

    } bcm_switch_reflector_data_t;

◆ bcm_switch_rov_get()

int bcm_switch_rov_get ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
uint32 *  rov 
)

An API to get the Recommended Operational Value.

An API to get the Recommended Operational Value for all FAPs and FEs by reading it from a register field and returning it as is. The field value returned is a Recommended Operational Value encoding which is interpreted in the device data sheet.

Parameters
[in,out]unitBCM device number.
[in,out]flagsFlags.
[in,out]rovRecommend operational voltage.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t_init()

void bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t_init ( bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t *  stat_type)

An API to initialize a bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t structure.

Initialize a bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t_init structure. The bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t is defined as:

// SER error statistics flags
#define BCM_SWITCH_SER_STAT_TCAM 0x00000001 // Error happens on TCAM memories
// This structure describes SER error statistics type.
typedef struct bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_s {
uint32 flags; // SER error statistics flags
bcm_switch_block_type_t block_type; // Block type
bcm_switch_error_type_t error_type; // SER error type
bcm_switch_correction_type_t correction_type; // SER error correction type
} bcm_switch_ser_error_stat_type_t;
Parameters
[in,out]stat_type(IN/OUT) pointer to ser statistics type parameter structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_ser_log_info_get()

int bcm_switch_ser_log_info_get ( int  unit,
int  id,
bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t *  info 
)

An API to get ser log info.

To get ser log info.

[in,out]idlog id.
[in,out]info(IN/OUT) pointer to ser log info parameter structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t_init()

void bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t_init ( bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t *  info)

An API to Initialize a bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t structure.

Initialize a bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t structure. The bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t is defined as:

// This structure describes SER log info.
typedef struct bcm_switch_ser_log_info_s {
uint32 time; // Error detected time
uint32 addr; // Error happened address
uint32 flags; // SER log info flags
int mem_reg; // Error happened memory or register id
uint8 name[BCM_MAX_MEM_REG_NAME]; // Error happened memory or register name
int index; // Error happened memory/register index
int port; // Error happened port id
int pipe; // Pipe num
int instance; // Instance id (MMU)
bcm_switch_block_type_t block_type; // Block type
bcm_switch_error_type_t error_type; // Error type
bcm_switch_correction_type_t correction_type; // Correction type
uint32 entry_data[BCM_MAX_MEM_WORDS]; // Corrupted entry data
uint32 cache_data[BCM_MAX_MEM_WORDS]; // Cache entry data
} bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t;

The flags is defined as:

SER log info flags for bcm_switch_ser_log_info_t
Name Description
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_MEM Error happens on memory
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_REG Error happens on register
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_MULTI Parity errors detected more than once.
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_CORRECTED Error be corrected by S/W
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_ENTRY Corrupt entry data is valid
BCM_SWITCH_SER_LOG_CACHE Cache data is valid

The bcm_switch_block_type_t is defined as:

// Block type
typedef enum bcm_switch_block_type_e {
bcmSwitchBlockTypeAll = -1, // All block types
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMmu = 0, // Memory Management Unit
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMmuGlb = 1, // MMU(Global)
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMmuXpe = 2, // MMU(Crosspoint Element)
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMmuSc = 3, // MMU(Slice Control)
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMmuSed = 4, // MMU(Slice Enqueue Dequeue)
bcmSwitchBlockTypeIpipe = 5, // Ingress pipeline
bcmSwitchBlockTypeEpipe = 6, // Egress pipeline
bcmSwitchBlockTypePgw = 7, // Packet GateWay
bcmSwitchBlockTypeClport = 8, // CLPORT
bcmSwitchBlockTypeXlport = 9, // XLPORT
bcmSwitchBlockTypeMacsec = 10, // MACSEC
bcmSwitchBlockTypePort = 11, // PORT including XLPORT CDPORT CLPORT etc.
bcmSwitchBlockTypeCount = 12 // Must be last.
} bcm_switch_block_type_t;

The bcm_switch_error_type_t is defined as:

// SER error type
typedef enum bcm_switch_error_type_e {
bcmSwitchErrorTypeAll = -1, // All error types
bcmSwitchErrorTypeUnknown = 0, // Unknown error type
bcmSwitchErrorTypeParity = 1, // Parity error
bcmSwitchErrorTypeEccSingleBit = 2, // Ecc single bit error
bcmSwitchErrorTypeEccDoubleBit = 3, // Ecc double bit error
bcmSwitchErrorTypeCount = 4 // Must be last.
} bcm_switch_error_type_t;

The bcm_switch_correction_type_t is defined as:

// SER error correction type
typedef enum bcm_switch_correction_type_e {
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeAll = -1, // All correction types
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeNoAction = 0, // S/W takes no action when error happens (Like some working memories)
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeFailToCorrect = 1, // S/W tries to correct error but fails
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeEntryClear = 2, // S/W writes NULL entry to clear the error
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeCacheRestore = 3, // Restore entry from a valid S/W cache
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeHwCacheRestore = 4, // Restore entry from another pipe
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeSpecial = 5, // Memory needs special correction handling
bcmSwitchCorrectTypeCount = 6 // Must be last.
} bcm_switch_correction_type_t;
Parameters
[in,out]info(IN/OUT) pointer to ser log info parameter structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_service_get()

int bcm_switch_service_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_service_t  service,
bcm_switch_service_config_t *  config 
)

Change/read configuration of specific service.

This API is used to apply/read the configuration specified in the config structure on a specific service. call bcm_switch_service_config_t_init function prior to passing it for _get API.

typedef enum bcm_switch_service_enabled_e {
bcmServiceStateDisabled, // Service disabled.
bcmServiceStateEnabled, // Service enabled.
bcmServiceEnabledCount // Maximum object count. This is not an object and should always be in the last
} bcm_switch_service_enabled_t;
typedef struct bcm_switch_service_config_s {
uint32 flags; // Option flags.
bcm_switch_service_enabled_t enabled; // Service enable configuration.
} bcm_switch_service_config_t;

flags - not defined yet for these APIs.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]serviceThe service to apply the configuration on.
[in,out]config(for _set) The configuration to set.
(for _get) The configuration status.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_temperature_monitor_get()

int bcm_switch_temperature_monitor_get ( int  unit,
int  temperature_max,
bcm_switch_temperature_monitor_t *  temperature_array,
int *  temperature_count 
)

There are temperature monitors embedded in the various points of some switch chips for the purpose of monitoring the health of the chip. This API retrieves each temperature monitor's current value and peak value. The value unit is 0.1 celsius degree. Table bcm_switch_temperature_monitor_t describes the meaning of each field of the structure bcm_switch_temperature_monitor_t.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]temperature_maxnumber of entries of the temperature_array.
[in,out]temperature_arraythe buffer array to hold the retrieved values.
[in,out]temperature_countactual number of entries retrieved.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_read()

int bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_read ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_type_t  sensor_type,
int  interface_id,
bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_t *  sensor_data 
)

Get switch thermo sensor data.

This API returns thermo sensors Data.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]sensor_typesensor type from enum
[in,out]interface_idinterface ID, ignored when not relevant
[in,out]sensor_datareturn data structure.
// Thermo Sensor Struct
typedef struct bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_s {
int thermo_sensor_min; // thermo sensor minimal read
int thermo_sensor_max; // thermo sensor maximal read
int thermo_sensor_current; // thermo sensor current read
} bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_t;
// Thermo sensors enum
typedef enum bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_type_e {
bcmSwitchThermoSensorInvalid = 0,
bcmSwitchThermoSensorDram = 1,
bcmSwitchThermoSensorSpare1 = 2,
bcmSwitchThermoSensorSpare2 = 3,
bcmSwitchThermoSensorCount = 4
} bcm_switch_thermo_sensor_type_t;
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_tpid_add()

int bcm_switch_tpid_add ( int  unit,
uint32  options,
bcm_switch_tpid_info_t *  tpid_info 
)

Add a global TPID.

This API is used to add a global TPID. Global TPIDs are used as a supply for ingress parser to get tag format of incoming packets, besides TPIDs configured per port. The device supports only one global TPID which is from the ingress inner TPID matching register for identifying the inner tag in L2 Tunnel payload. The global TPID is initialized to 0x8100 by default. Old global L2 Tunnel TPID must be deleted before adding a new one.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]optionsFuture expansion i.e, REPLACE option.
[in,out]tpid_infoTPID info includes key: {tpid_type, tpid_value} and Associated value(s): {flags, color}.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_tpid_class_get()

int bcm_switch_tpid_class_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_tpid_class_t *  tpid_class 
)

Get the tpid profile from a given port or ingress vlan translation action ID.

Get the tpid class from a given port or ingress vlan translation action ID. The retrieved tpid class can be used for configuring egress native vlan classification and other purposes.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]tpid_class(IN/OUT) TPID class retrieval information.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_switch_tpid_class_t_init()

void bcm_switch_tpid_class_t_init ( bcm_switch_tpid_class_t *  tpid_class)

Initialize a bcm_switch_tpid_class_t structure.

Initializes a TPID class retrieval information structure to default values. Whereas bcm_switch_tpid_class_t is defined as:

// TPID class retrieval information structure.
typedef struct bcm_switch_tpid_class_s {
uint32 flags; // BCM_SWITCH_TPID_CLASS_XXX, unused now.
bcm_switch_tpid_class_match_t match; // Match criteria for tpid_class_id
bcm_gport_t port; // Port ID
int vlan_translation_action_id; // Translation action ID
uint32 tpid_class_id; // TPID-profile
} bcm_switch_tpid_class_t;

And bcm_switch_tpid_class_match_t is defined as:

// TPID class match type.
typedef enum bcm_bcm_switch_tpid_class_match_e {
bcmTpidClassMatchPort = 0, // tpid_class_id from port.
bcmTpidClassMatchIngVlanActionId = 1, // tpid_class_id from Ingress vlan translation action id
bcmTpidClassMatch_count = 2 // Number of match criterion
} bcm_bcm_switch_tpid_class_match_t;
Parameters
[in,out]tpid_class(IN/OUT) TPID class retrieval information.
Return values
NOTHING

◆ bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_get()

int bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_get ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t *  monitor 
)

These APIs set/get monitor configuration for trace events defined in <bcm/types.h>.

These APIs set/get monitor configuration for a trace event. A monitor defines a trace event and the associated actions. The supported actions are defined in BCM_SWITCH_MON_ACTION_XXX. For set, the caller must specify a trace event and the associated actions in the monitor structure. For get, the caller must specify a trace event in the monitor structure. The associated actions will be returned.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]monitor(for set) Pointer to switch trace event monitor structure.
(IN/OUT) (for get) Pointer to switch trace event monitor structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_set()

int bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_set ( int  unit,
bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t *  monitor 
)

These APIs set/get monitor configuration for trace events defined in <bcm/types.h>.

These APIs set/get monitor configuration for a trace event. A monitor defines a trace event and the associated actions. The supported actions are defined in BCM_SWITCH_MON_ACTION_XXX. For set, the caller must specify a trace event and the associated actions in the monitor structure. For get, the caller must specify a trace event in the monitor structure. The associated actions will be returned.

Parameters
[in,out]unitUnit number.
[in,out]monitor(for set) Pointer to switch trace event monitor structure.
(IN/OUT) (for get) Pointer to switch trace event monitor structure.
Return values
BCM_E_XXXBCM_E_NONE on success and error code otherwise.

◆ bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t_init()

void bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t_init ( bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t *  monitor)

Initialize a bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t structure.

Initialize a switch trace event monitor parameters structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any such structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t structure, and bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values. The bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t structure is defined as follows:

// Switch trace event monitor structure.
typedef struct bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_s {
bcm_pkt_trace_event_t trace_event; // Trace event.
uint32 actions; // BCM_SWITCH_MON_ACTION_XXX actions definitions.
} bcm_switch_trace_event_mon_t;
Parameters
[in,out]monitor(IN/OUT) Pointer to a switch trace event monitor structure.
Return values
NOTHING

◆ bcm_switch_user_buffer_read()

int bcm_switch_user_buffer_read ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_switch_user_buffer_type_t  buff_type,
uint8 *  buf,
int  offset,
int  nbytes 
)

Reads data from the user buffer.

This API is used for reading data from the user buffers

[in,out]offsetThe offset in the user dram buffer
[in,out]nbytesNumber of bytes to be read
